  2581. The button to operate the \\"turbo\\" feature (totally unnecessary) is extremely cheap and came off the first time I pressed it.
  2582. Unfortunately, I have no faith that this one will perform and hold-up any better than the first.
  2583. The T-980 is larger around and heavier than the older unit...
  2584. The beard cutting is very uniform, seems to be plenty of height adjustment settings, and about 95% of the trimmings magically got sucked into the little chamber instead of all over my bathroom counter, which is a huge boost for my marriage!
  2585. (the little metal rod under the head that spins to move the blades back and forth) to solve a decrease in performance, but this is easily done by turning on the trimmer and poking with the brush provided until the hairs come out.
  2586. As advised in the operating manual, I started with a longer length and worked my way down to a setting that fit what I wanted by simply turning a dial.
  2587. Since this model is no longer available, (I would have bought it again), and since Remington, no longer offers a vacuum trimmer for some odd reason, I had to look elsewhere.
  2588. Not bad, but a little pricey.
  2589. The vacuum feature actually works pretty well.
  2590. trimmer might be the best compromise of cost / features / functionality out there, but was disappointed with the vacuum capabilities even on Turbo.
  2591. It has the vacuum and a extra Turbo function that your first time you'll think it's going to pull off all the hair.
  2592. The other reviews are right about the turbo mode, though.
  2593. What little the vacuum doesn't catch is easily wiped with a sponge.
  2594. Because of the vacuum, you cannot do close trimming with the main head and switching heads is a pain.

  5. I have always had trouble keeping by beard as short as I like and this trimmer solved that problem. In addition it allows me to make a smooth line where I trim the beard completely.
  6. I started shaving my head over ten years ago and I am so glad I found the T980. I can get a just clippered look without leaving tiny pieces of hair everywhere. I am a neat freak so this device is perfect for me. It is powerful and easy to use. The vacuum really works and emptying is a breeze. It is also more comfortable on sensitive areas like my neck than other clippers I have used in the past. I used to put off shaving my head, but it is so simple now that I do it every few days. I would reccomend this to anyone.
  7. This trimmer is pretty good. Trims well. Mostly used for personal body grooming. It is easily cleanable with most important parts just pulling off. The price is fair.<br />The battery capacity is excellent. Have used a half dozen times without need for recharging. Cordless feature is great to trim in shower and not make a mess in bathroom.<br />The bells and whistles such as turbo power and vacuum chamber are more annoying than useful. The vacuum chamber fills really fast and if you have black hair you can not distinguish it against the groomer's black body color despite what the advertisements claim. When the chamber is full cutting ability drops dramatically. The work around is just pull off or keep open the chamber door while grooming.<br />I have not figured out what turbo is for, sure the blades move faster and the device is louder but since we're triming hair and not a full lawn of grass it seems pretty pointless.<br />The power button is very sensitive and an inadvertant flick of a finger easily shuts off (or turns on trimmer). Not a disaster but slightly annoying.<br />As far as reliability it has lasted longer than my previous Panasonic so that's a plus.
  8. My fiance is quite pleased with this vacuum trimmer- as am I since there's no longer bits of his hair all over the place! He's had it for a few months now and is very happy with it. It's very easy to adjust the setting for different lengths as well. His beard is looking great! Highly recommended!
  9. I researched beard trimmers and the customer reviews I found were very positive for this model. So I ordered it on Amazon. I am very pleased with the purchase. It does a good job, maintains a nice charge, and I was amazed at how well it vacuums the trimmed beard hairs into the waste compartment. When I had used a scissors to trim my beard, the results were just so-so and there was always a big mess to clean up. But this produt does a very nice job and it makes very little to no mess. I reccomend this purchase.

  15. This trimmer is marketed toward facial hair and sideburns, and that's all it's good for. Anything finer than coarse facial hair jams up the vacuum system, so forget about buzz cuts or body grooming. When the vacuum part is backed up, it blocks hair from entering the blades, forcing you to clean it several times per trimming session. The vacuum is weak at best, and left me cleaning up almost as much hair from my counter as my previous, non-vacuum trimmer. Although I've enjoyed Norelco products in the past, this one has been a disappointment and will be on its way back to Amazon tomorrow.
  16. I use this to cut my hair and maintain my haircuts. It works great, but it does get clogged with long hairs. I love how it sucks up the hair. This is a necessity for men, you should own one.
  17. Have had this trimmer for a couple months now and love it. This trimmer holds a charge for a good amount of time and is very easy and comfortable to use. With the addition of the turbo feature, almost no hair trimmings in the sink.Would definitely recommend this trimmer to anyone with a beard.
  18. This trimmer works very well. I would definitely recommend this to someone. The battery lasts a long time between charges and the trimmer is quite powerful. Be sure to start at the longest trim setting the first time you use it and then work your way shorter to your desired length. The vacuum could be a little better. I usually have to have the \\"turbo\\" turned on for it to be really effective. Even with the vacuum, expect a little clean-up at the end, but not nearly as much as there would be without the vacuum. The vacuum storage is a touch on the small side. I sometimes have to empty it twice in one setting. Still, it's a lot easier than having all that hair flying all over the sink. Overall, I have been very satisfied.
  19. I love this trimmer. Different parts of my beard require different settings. Many other trimmers require you to change heads. With the twist action settings on this razor, I quickly change settings and get my beard right every time. The vacuum works pretty well. It doesn't get all the trimmings, but it does get a majority of them. It's easy to clean after use. The best beard trimmer I've used.

  21. I just bought a Phillips-Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer, and if any of you men or women are looking to give your beard that perpetual 'George Michael-esque' look, search no further. This thing is frikin' sweet.<br /><br />Works as advertised. Trims fast. Does not pull the hair. Does not need to be used on turbo mode, works great on regular mode. Set the dial to (1), and you'll be in that 1.5mm length mark. I was concerned that this trimmer would get that close, but not too close trim. The shaver effortlessly leaves you with that 5 o'clock shadow. Turn the dial a couple clicks to (3 or 4), a bit longer, and then thin-out your sideburns. Travel case included.<br /><br />Vacuum: worked great on regular power (non-turbo) mode, and let only a few hairs drop to the sink. I think the hairs just fell because I was trimming so quickly.<br /><br />Adjustable Guard: Glides smooth. Adjusts quickly. Durable, not flimsy. Removes instantly for a closer trim. Open the compartment door, and brush out the trimmed hairs.

  31. After reading many reviews of this product I was sold and went ahead and ordered it. My mistake. The unit is apparently not designed for heavy, thick or long beard hair, as it does not trim that well, the vacuum just clogs up and then blades tend to pull rather than cut smoothly. The blade guard (?) just lets hair jam up against the blades, which again makes for a less comfortable trim. My plan is to now get a much simpler version of this type trimmer and go back to trimming as I have always done it.
  32. Purchased the T980 trimmer in January (is now mid-Oct), and it has worked well. This replaced an earlier Norelco whose battery finally gave up (+ it got dropped a couple of times...), and - for once - the replacement actually seems better than the original. Unit shipped with a decent (not great) flip-cover travel case, large enough for the trimmer & charger, and with a small net pouch for the narrow trimming head (which has not been used). Have also never needed the \\"Turbo\\" mode. The \\"vacuum\\" feature on the T980 works somewhat better than the earlier unit: it does not catch everything, but certainly captures most of the clippings. The flip open door to empty the contents is convenient. Don't care for the hard body, but there is a nice rubber ring (used to change the cutting depth) that makes a good grip point. Find it difficult to read the \\"zoom\\" - that is, cutting depth - setting from certain angles / lighting conditions, but this is not a major problem. After some 9 months of use, this unit still looks great, cuts great, and has a pleasingly long battery life. It lacks a multi-LED charge indicator, but does have a \\"Low\\" battery warning light (+ a Charge light) & the unit will still run for several beard trimmings once the warning light comes on. All-in-all, a good purchase.
  33. Very happy with this trimmer.<br />It does leave a few hairs in the sink, but that's expected with all trimmers.<br />Quick and easy to use.
  34. I've been using this over a year and it does the job. The provided pre-set lengths are pretty good and usually work for the style I need. It shaves cleanly and hasn't given me any trouble. Battery lasts well over a week with daily trimming, but I do notice the motor begins to turn a bit slower after several days on the battery. The mustache/sideburn trimmer is average and does the job. The beard trimmer is pretty good, but has trouble getting really close under my nose. I sometimes have to go over that area several times to get it as close as I like. The vacuum will only catch about 3/4 of the hair. The other 1/4 will be all over your sink and need to be cleaned up. Emptying the vacuum chamber is easy though. The vacuum is also loud enough that it would wake up someone sleeping in the same room but not the next room. There is a flashing light on the charger that can get annoying in a completely dark room unless you turn the shaver upside down while shaving. Apparently this model has been upgraded to this unit: [...]

  37. it's very convenient as it sucks up hair into the chamber. But do not exspect this product to fully suck up all the hairs it shaves, it still leaves some hairs to fall on you or on the sink/floor. I use this on my beard and to stubble-look my own hair, if you use this on your hair aside from your beard, some hairs get stuck and clog the opening of the vacuum that leads to the chamber, you have to remove the clippers and cutters to remove it. Have to use the Power mode on my hair though. But overall, nice product. But have to give it a 4-star as it still has some hairs falling down on you or on the sink, I expected this to suck the hairs it cuts all up. It just minimizes the mess, and it's good though.
  38. The T980 works very well for a consumer-grade device. The batteries last much longer than necessary (at least, in the first few months of ownership) but using the trimmer corded isn't a problem. And it's a snap to use. There are a couple things you should know. First, the highest setting is about 3/4\\" so if you want parts of your beard longer, you won't have the automatic height setting available. Second, the shaping parts around the cutting head are all plastic, so this device wouldn't last long in a professional environment (where it might get dropped). The vacuum collects perhaps 90% of your trimmings. Plan on changing shirts after use. :)

The only reason I did not return it is because it will work with AC power. The last Norelco trimmer, the battery life become so short, so quickly that it would not even let me finish trimming my beard on one charge, which is quite pathetic. Pros: Uses AC power, okay triming attachment, vacuume is an okay idea Cons: Loud, high pitched motor (particularly annoying in turbo mode), weak motor if used in standard mode, too easy to accidentally hit the on switch, guard is difficult to put on (doesn't allign easily), cheap plastic cover for hair collector broke after just a few uses.   45. I've had a beard for over 25 years. I'd used Wahl products before... they're not terrible, but most trimmers leave a mess, particularly with thick coarse beards like mine. 1 This product has a \\"dial\\" for different height settings. I dial a 3 for my beard (which I keep close), and change to a 4 for my moustache. (Settings are 1-9, with 1 giving you a \\"1 day growth\\" look). This trimmer does a good job vacuuming the trimmings, and is easy to clean. There is a plastic door that opens to readily empty the vacuumed clippings. There is a separate trim attachment for the sideburn or trim function... it doesn't take that long to change, but I could see where this might be an aggravation for a sideburn/goatee' kind of guy. My razor has a popout trimmer that I use for this purpose, so it isn't an issue for me.
  46. Outstanding product, well built, durable, has features that are used, many beard length settings use and no need to pick up whiskers with vacuum feature. Only negative is with vacuum rectangular hole next to cut line the exact location of cut line while trimming less certain.
  47. The last accuvac I had from Norelco lasted about 5 years and just died. Since it worked so well and does a pretty good job of keeping the sink and counter clean I decided to stick with this brand. This is the only one that I found that could be used while plugged in. My old one seemed to like to die occasionally when I wasn't quite finished using it so I had to wait for it to charge for a little while just to be able to finish up. With this one I could plug it in finish up and then it would charge to full capacity, that is great. I'm not so sure about the hair chamber as the old one I had had a removable hair chamber, this one only actually has a door but I guess it works fine. Others have mentioned the power button was touchy, I don't really agree. The way I hold it it wouldn't get pushed unless I meant to push it. Two thumbs up.

  51. How in the world does this thing get 5 stars? The adjustable trimmer doesn't 'snap' when adjusting to number 2 trim. It also silently switches from trim number 3 - 2 if you press down hard enough. Also the blade has a 'shield' that aids in sucking the cut hair down into the collection chamber. The problem is the 'shield' blocks the head of the blade. Very dangerous if your cutting a line for your moustache-- your literally cutting blind. It does come with a cheap attachment for linings, but I prefer cutting from the blade, like in the older models. Too much of my life depends on how good of a shave I give myself. This time Norelco doesn't cut it. The one star is for the vacuum.
  52. I purchased this trimmer as an upgrade to my older T900 model. The vacuum definitely reduces the mess. It's not perfect even on turbo but catches nearly 90% of what previously was 100% of hair on my sink. The turbo is not that loud (no significant difference between normal mode and turbo). My one observation is that the moustache trimmer attachment seems less precise than the one on the T900 however it can still produce the same results. Although the mechanics look the same this one felt like it delivered a smoother shave than my older model. Less mess, lighter device, overall this is an acceptable upgrade.
  53. I owned another Norelco beard trimmer with a vacuum in it ... until my wife broke it by knocking it off the shelf. But now I'm glad she did. On the old one, the vacuum was fairly useless because just as much hair ended up in the sink and all over the blade as in the catcher bin. Maybe more.<br /><br />But the T980 Turbo (and don't all guys love stuff with \\"Turbo\\" in the description?) does the job. Yes, I know it has two settings: Turbo on and Turbo off. But I see no reason to use it with Turbo off because then it's just like the old underpowered version. But with Turbo on it collects nearly all those little hairs. (Some get away, but many fewer.)<br /><br />Some people say that the Turbo is too loud, which is why they offer an option I suppose, but in our house the bathroom is far enough away and well-insulated enough that no one can hear it running full blast.<br /><br />One caveat: It's better to trim the beard dry not wet. Remember to trim it before you get in the shower because when the hair is wet the vacuum still has trouble collecting the hairs, even on Turbo. Plus showering washes any remaining trimmings away. Yes, this may be self-evident to some of you, but I hadn't thought of it before. Keep in mind I'm doing this before morning coffee.<br /><br />So no more little hairs all over my daughter after daddy kisses and snuggles her. I like the T980 trimmer.
  54. The Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer is a fantastic beard trimmer. I use this to trim and shape my moustache as well. The vacuum works better when you use the turbo vacuum. Worth every penny!

  57. as a first time beard grower, trimming a beard was at best enigmatic. <br />I had only the vaguest of images as to what a beard should look like. It was <br />not unlike \\"what should a haircut look like.\\" There is no answer. The <br />difference between a good haircut and a bad haircut is two weeks. The <br />literature with the Norelco didn't give a smidgen of help. Other than that, <br />the trimmer itself was easy to assemble (the ideographs on the instruction <br />sheet were of little help!), was easy to use, was easy to clean, and produced <br />excellent results. I would highly recommend it.
  58. This is the best beard trimmer I've ever had. The trimmer guide has 9 very precise trimming length settings - I found a 5 setting perfect for a medium length beard. The vacuum works great and catches all the loose hair during the trimming process. It also has an attachment for more precise areas such as the mustache area. It is a very comfortable size to hold as well and easy to use. I took it on a couple trips and it is lightweight and the battery lasts forever. I got 5 trims before charging and I think I could have gotten at least one more. Overall a great product especially for the money.
  59. The best of the best, fast, clean and very suitable. And the Amazon price is so good. I've been using trimmers since i was 20 and i can tell this is the best i tried. Go for it.
  60. I have had this item for over a year. Lots of power and stays sharp. LOVE IT!
  61. Let me start off with I am not what you would call a heavy user. The vac feature of this product works great. I have not noticed any hair falling on the floor provided you keep the hair collection bin cleaned out. Best trimmer I have used.
  62. Never have I owned a more poorly designed device. Try traveling with the trimmer and you'll soon realize the power button is activated if anything puts pressure on the device. The thing will be vibrating in your bag. Or you may turn it off accidentally while shaving. It also has a few counterintuitive add ons that make it seem like you're putting together a jalopy just to shave. Do not buy this thing. It was designed cheaply and made cheaply. Unbelieveable!

  67. I own an earlier model, which I prefer, but the battery died. The hair catcher was a cup that could be removed and be easily dumped into a waste basket; this model has a fragile door, the hairs do not easily come out or off of the filter and tapping the unit could damage it. Both shavers require a light pressure or the setting can suddenly change to a shorter length. Turbo speed is really not necessary. Nice 70 minute charge, comfortable to hold, and attractive style. Overall, I feel it will work well but I am leary of the shavings door. It does a nice job, as I expected. I have no experience with any other brand to compare. I suggest a can of compressed air be handy and to blow the shavings out after each use, which defeats the neatness of the vacuum collection, but blow lightly over a waste basket.
  68. I've had four different beard trimmers and this is by far the best. It does an excellent job, and I have found little need to turn on the turbo feature. This is the second vacuum unit I've owned and is significantly better in performance and features than the first.

  70. This thing works well and it really does create much less hair in your sink. I use it daily.
  71. This shaver really is a treat to use. I have had no difficulty with the \\"grade\\" of shave slipping mid shave and I find it a very comfortable shaver to use.<br />The shave is quick and the receptacle really does seem to catch upwards of 95% of what I'm using.<br />So far I've had four shaves off the one charge and I shave once a week, so the battery seems to hold its charge really well.<br />Cleaning is a cinch.<br />It's noisy with turbo on, but certainly not in the same vicinity as a hair dryer. It's certainly not anything that's a detraction from the shave.<br />The only reason I haven't given this 5 stars is because of the area just under the nose, the other reviewers that have mentioned this are correct - it's very hard to get to this area without contorting your nose and/or lip.<br />I simply remove the protector and do the last few hairs freehand with the open shaver or a pair of cuticle scissors.<br />The overall performance of this shaver more than makes up for this one shortcoming.<br />Very nice carrying bag too included.
  72. This is an adequate trimmer. I bought it to replace a previous Norelco trimmer that I had for years. The vacuum is not strong enough to prevent lots of hairs everywhere, but post-trim cleanup is much faster now. Not any louder than my previous trimmer, even on \\"turbo\\", which I always have on. On the non-Turbo setting, the trim quality is noticeably degraded. On Turbo the trim is pretty good. The comb does not allow good mustache trimming. Overall this trimmer is pretty good, but is not the all-in-one trimmer that I was looking for. I would try a different product if I had it to do all over again.

If it was a bit smaller, I would have given it a 5, but I recommend it without reservation.

  76. I scoured the net looking for the perfect beard trimmer to trim my beard that I brough back from Iraq. I didn't want to look like a terrorist, so I needed a trimmer to keep my beard looking civilized. I read the reviews here and was prepared for a somewhat weak vacuum- even on turbo. No big deal- I wanted results, and the vacuum was just a perk anyway. It caught maybe half the hair on turbo, so whoopie. Well, I should have paid more attention to the negative reviews! I was careful not to hold the trimmer by the click wheel to avoid accidentally going down a setting... I did that once and clicked from a 5 to a 4. I liked the 4 better anyway, so stuck with that. I happily trimmed to a 4 once a week (sometimes twice to clean it up) for the last couple months and it worked well, until just a couple of days ago when the setting slipped all the way down to 1 when I was in the middle of shaving! I went from a nice beard to the 5 o-clock shadow look! I AM FURIOUS! There needs to be some sort of setting lock that prevents it from just slipping and ruining your beard! How hard would that be? Just build the dial with a notch you can slide a bar into in order to lock it! Until they build this with a locking device, avoid it, or you could lose your hard-earned beard- just like I did!

No, the vacuum doesn't pick up everything, but it makes clean up much much less bothersome than the old trimmer I used.   81. I purchased this item because I was tired of leaving hairs all over the place and because I had lost the charger for my old trimmer. Bottom line up front: this thing trims and has lots of nice features, but is not worth leaving a working trimmer in the trash for. The item comes with different heads, one of which will give you a wide range of length adjustments that are easily switched between. The unit feels solid as a whole and also has a reasonable case (it doesn't seem to be dedicated to holding each part in a certain place, but instead it holds everything in one pouch). The vacuum action will catch most hairs, but you can't get away with not trimming over a sink. It will still allow some hairs to get away; it's no Flowbee. The end result is better than nothing, but not a complete solution. As I said before, if you have a trimmer that works for you now, stick with it. You can get this if the current one breaks. It's not going to make trimming a new experience or solve the world's problems, but it's a competent trimmer that reduces some of the clean-up.

  90. The Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer allowed me to achieve and maintain the beard length I was seeking more precisely and efficiently than any other trimmer I have owned. (My wife especially likes the job it does.) The vacuum function works well and makes clean-up a ten-second job. The battery provides a couple week's worth of uses before it needs recharging, which takes a bit over an hour. The somewhat bulky size to accommodate the vacuum unit requires an initial adjustment if you're used to smaller units. The nine-position trimming guard allows you to work down to the length you want and prevents accidental mess-ups. This tool gets my most enthusiastic endorsement.
  91. There are a ton of reviews here, so no need to go into great detail about what everyone else mentions, but I'll summarize anyway. It works very well, the battery life between charges is very good, it looks nice, and as many others write, it does a great job at vacuuming up trimmed hairs, even if a few escape.<br /><br />My criticisms are:<br /><br />1. I wish the case that came with it were more compact, even form fitting. The one I received was basically a small pouch with a flap that seems almost like an afterthought design-wise.<br /><br />2. The power on button went off many times when traveling, due to the fairly sensitive button being flush with the shaver. This could be prevented if the button was recessed and/or there was a lock switch to lock the trimmer off completely when traveling. A few times, it accidentally turned on and started buzzing in my suitcase and caused a few stares, and even a few chuckles, if you know what I mean. A form-fitting case that has a space around the button would also help.<br /><br />3. I agree with other reviewers: I wish this was designed so that the mini-trimmer attachment was on the other side of the head, so that there are no attachments at all. Perhaps this could be re-designed so that a simple switch (like on a reversible screwdriver) could switch back and forth between the beard trimmer and the mini attachment.<br /><br />All in all, I am very happy with this trimmer, but would purchase another one if they addressed the previously mentioned issues.

This trimmer does not need to be re-charged regularly or plugged in to maintain its charge. That is a benefit.

  99. I bought the T980 to replace a trusty T765 that had finally died after several years. Bad idea! The plastic hair chamber fell apart after just a few months. And the turbo function doesn't really help anyway; it drops a lot of whiskers. So I went back to the T765 and I'm glad I did-- fewer bells and whistles but it does the job!
  100. It trimmed without inflicting pain. Thats the best I can say about this machine. The setting indicator is so small I need my reading glasses to insure I've got it right. Swiching to the sideburn/edge trimmer involves removing the adjustable guide, the trimmer head, and replacing with the edge trimming head. Part alignment must be perfect of they don't fit. Replacing the guide comb requires precision as well. A pop-up trimmer would have solved those problems. The vacuum is gimmick that works more or less, but the recepticle can pop open without warning and dump lots of little trimmings everywhere. The carrying case does not seal... just a velcro flap... so when packed, bristles can get spread around your suitcase. I dropped it yesterday, and broke one of the trim heads. I was unable to find replacement parts online, and I must say I was relieved to be forced to replace this unit with a better designed model.

  105. When my old beard trimmer conked out after a half dozen years, I wanted a nice new one. Not the clunker my wife had purchased for me six years ago that pulled hairs, kept my sink a mess, and looked cheap. So I typed in Google, \\"What is the best beard trimmer?\\" On two of three sites I checked, the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer was tops. What sold me, was the video of one reviewer actually using the trimmer and explaining all of its functions and how to use it. As an aside, the Amazon reviews were helpful as well - so when I was shaving and turned the trimmer on its side, I was not surprised when hairs fell out of the vaccum trap. That being said, the beard trimmer worked just as I had hoped. I look forward to taking time out once a week to trim my beard. The guard feels good against my skin and the hairs are all evenly cut. I haven't had a pulled hair yet. The shaper works well, giving nice clean lines. And the vaccum works great with the beard trimmer and guard - 99% of hair winds up in the vaccum chamber. The pieces are easy to clean and adjust. Negatives and these are minor andonly have to do with the vaccum. Mind you, if there was no vaccum my sink would be filled with black hairs, so having any type of vaccum is great. The negatives are: 1. if you turn your hand too far over, the hairs will start to spill out - that's happened twice in the eight times I've used it so far. And it was only a little. 2. The vaccuum is realitively useless with the shaper as other reviewers have mentioned. One other thing, where the beard meets my hairline just above the ear, I've found the guard obstructs the view a bit so it's hard to see where to stop. It's probably just a thing of practice and the length of my beard, but I figured I'd let everyone know where I find myself taking a little bit of time when shaving. Definately a good buy. I look forward to beard trimming day.

This product does what you'd expect it to, and it does it well: Trim your beard (or hair, if you're patient) and vacuum up the trimmings. It doesn't catch 100%, but it gets pretty close. In general, it's a worthwhile product.<br /><br />However, it is fair to mention one fatal flaw with this design: the vacuum door hinge. It is constructed of brittle plastic, and the hinge crumbled on me after 15 months of use. I have since decided to try a non-vacuum product by Wahl. If Norelco could change the design of the trimming area to eliminate the hinged door design -- say a small cup that you snap out and empty instead -- then this product would be flawless and guaranteed to last for years. As it stands, I'm going to wait for this product to evolve a little further before purchasing from Norelco again -- unless a competitor comes up with an improved design first!

  128. I have had this item for almost three months now, and I am quite happy with it. Noting some of the issues in other reviews, I would have to add: - The battery is adequate. I use it every five days or so, and it holds a charge for close to a month. - I have a close cropped beard, and keep it that way using level 3. Setting it to levels 2 or 1 will give you the \\"couple of days growth\\" look. - The vacuum picks up more than 90% of the clippings, leaving the bathroom sink nearly hair free. I suspect that buyers who are having trouble with this feature have longer beards, and longer hairs might not be caught as easily. The razor does everything I wanted it to do, and I would purchase it again.
  129. I love the way my boyfriend looks a day or two after shaving, so after doing some research I found this razor. After using this, he has that sexy \\"scruffy\\" but manicured look. He's never owned an electric razor before, but he enjoys using this. He says it's easy and comfortable-doesn't pull or hurt at all. And now he doesn't have to shave the old-fashioned way any more!
  130. It is OK. It does its job. You need time to become more accustomed with it. You need to pass it a couple of times until the surface is really even. But eventually you receive what you wanted. I tried to use this device for other parts of the body and it works. Of course you should be more careful. It can be easily dismantled for cleaning or razor head exchange and assembled again. The cleaning is not very easy, probably because of the brush. The vacuum collects up to 95% of the cut hairs and the rest should be collected manually, but, I think, it is still worth. A battery keeps its charge very well and a recharge process is easy and quick. It is very helpful too that it can be used with a cord power supply. I do not have an experience with other trimmers and cannot compare it.
  131. I had a previous model of this trimmer and loved it. This one is just as good.
  132. Have been using the T980 for about a month and it works very well. This is my second beard trimmer in about 10 years and don't often grow a beard so I'm not an expert but do think the T980 works fine to very well. The only complaint I can think of is that I'd prefer finer granularity between settings, meaning I'd like to be able to trim at number 3 and 1/2 (3 is a bit too short for my linking, 4 a bit too long). It's minor; I'm getting used to #3. Battery life seems fine, haven't needed to charge it since the initial charging. A good trimmer for the $.
  133. I've owned this for like a week now and my first time using it I was FREAKEN amazed. I had a crappy old vacuum beard trimmer by Remmington that I replaced because It would never trim evenly, even if I really really tried, I'd always end up with a bald spot on my chinstrap haha. I actually finally dropped it one day and bent one of the plastic trimming guides so I said to hell with this damn thing! I always trimmed in a downward fashion with my old one because if I went up it would reduce it to stubble even with the right length setting. So I busted this beast out set it to 4 turned it on and put it on turbo (sorry I'm a sucker for a things that say turbo hah)! The trimming head actually bends to the contours of your face and trims every single hair to the same height when shaving upward. Now my chinstrap no longer looks patchy it's just full and even, don't waste your time with scissors or a \\"bunk\\" trimmer, get this one! I didn't have a giant beard for my first shave but I'm sure this thing can get through the narliest of beards...not that you would ever wanna shave a good beard off. So for the beard lover and facial hair perfectionist, this thing does an A+++ job! Just for review integrity I personally did not purchase this, my mother purchased it for me as a gift! :) She, and the girlfriend loved the difference.
  134. This trimmer is a joke. I purchased it to replace an older Norelco for my husband. The vacuum does catch some of the hair but there is still hair all over him and the bathroom after he has used it. He doesn't like the feel of it and he finds it difficult to get an even trim. Worse, the plastic guard broke off after six months The only good thing I have to say about this trimmer is it holds a charge for seemingly forever. Purchase a different trimmer, this one is not as good as you hope it will be.

  137. Yep - this thing is awesome... The zero feature makes it look like you shaved that morning and the stubble has just barely started to grow in, and if you wanted to be completely hairless maybe you should have asked to have been born a woman. The battery lasts for weeks and the vacuum, though loud, is EXTREMELY effective. The decibel level of the vacuum should not bother any red blooded man who enjoys going to sporting events and screaming at the top of his lungs, or watching a dragster blast down a quarter mile in 4 seconds. This thing could chisel the beard off of Chuck Norris AND Rosie O'donnel in one charge!

  143. I was going to buy a Wahl trimmer as that is what I have been useing for years...it was a great trimmer...adjustable length long battery life..When it died on me I thought \\"well\\" I'll just get a new Wahl..the problem was they didnt make the one I have any more...thats when I thought I would make a change to see what else is out there..I looked on the web for 2 days trying to figure out what would be my next purchase...my beard got longer and didnt want to make the wrong choice...I read all the articles, reviews and then this trimmer was in front of me...never thought of getting one with a vaccuum on it...seemed simple enough just to wash the mess down the sink..and off the sink..and shake out my shirt and ...well you get the point..just didnt think that the vaccuum would be that good since it was cordless...it was really a surprise when I got it ..it got all but two little hairs the first time out..and the rest is history..it has all the options I want plus the vaccuum..If I ever have a complaint on this trimmer I will repost or add if possible to this review...but I like my choice and have no regrets.. PROS: works great, vaccuum is a plus, have not recharged it since I got it. CONS: none, yet. UPDATE: well its sept 26 and all is well..I have not had to recharge this trimmer since I bought it. I still have no problems with it. it took a trim or two to get used to the new settings from my old trimmer but what dont you have to get used to when you change brands. I read a few articles from other users saying they had hair all over the place when they used it. they either look like grizzly adams and try to mow the whole thing at once or? I cut from the bottom of my face going up and never had more than a few hairs that didnt get in the vaccuum. It might depend on your style of cutting,havnt tried from the top down to see if the vaccuum gets it all. thats not my style of trimming. In my book its perfect..do you know why things are not always perfect because everybody has their own opinion. I hope this helps you in any way..Lyndon

  151. Like many of the reviewers here, I was actually seeking an overall body hair trimmer when I came across the Norelco T980. After several months of continuous use (as a body hair trimmer), I have not been disappointed. Here are some of the highlights: * The blades remain sharp, never requiring further sharpening, nor rinsing or oiling. The blades have also never pulled any hairs, making for a pain-free trim * The vacuum component works really well to collect and house the trimmings, keeping the bathroom sink free of stray hairs * Ease of use to change through nine different blade lengths, without needing to swap for extra components * Turbo button to boost the speed of the blades is a nice feature * Sideburn accessory is very handy for keeping the 'burns neatly trimmed * The internal battery holds a charge for a remarkably long time * Travel pouch and charger make for an easy-to-travel-with item Keep in mind that if your intended use is for a body hair trimmer, the Norelco T980 does not shave the skin completely smooth -- as that is not in its intended design. But if you are seeking a trimmer to crop and maintain body hair, especially facial hair, this is an ideal tool to have.

Other than that, fantastic.

  165. I went to this after using a Braun Cruzer which had a trimmer attachment which was MUCH closer, but unfortunately broke after I stupidly put it in my checked luggage during a transatlantic flight.<br /><br />So I decided to get this Norelco for its vac feature because with the Braun, it was kind of a pain to clean up all the little hairs on the sink after each use. The vac feature works well, gets about 95% of the whiskers.<br /><br />The main drawback with the Norelco however is that with the adjustable guard off, it doesn't provide nearly as close a trim as the Braun. I confirmed this by looking closely at both products' trimmer blades. The distance between the stationary and the moving blade on the Braun was maybe 1mm; on this Norelco T980, it was more like 3mm. So if you're buying this trimmer in order to cultivate a stubble look, be aware that with the T980 you'll have to use it more often.<br /><br />The vacuum intake vent makes it a bit harder to maneuver the trimmer as well.<br /><br />Another annoyance is that it doesn't get the occasional whisker that lies almost flat to the skin without repeated passes. This is probably the result of the aforementioned greater distance between the edge of the stationary and moving blades.<br /><br />So, this has been my main disappointment with this product. To get a closer shave, I had to use the smaller mini-trimmer attachment which unfortunately doesn't work as well with the vacuum, so a lot more hairs were all over my sink. Plus was a bit uncomfortable in that sometimes it would catch on my skin more than the normal sized trimmer attachment.<br /><br />The Norelco is also bulkier and less ergonomic than the Braun, but I guess that's the price of having the vac feature.<br /><br />Sigh, if only Braun would make the same trimmer with a vacuum function! I'd snap that baby up in a heartbeat.<br /><br />Or maybe the truth is that *I* am paying a high price for my laziness regarding cleaning up post-shave whiskers off the sink myself, vs. having a lower-quality trimmer with a vac function. LOL<br /><br />3 and 1/2 stars.r with a vac function. LOL 3 and 1/2 stars.

  171. Overall the trimmer works well on my beard. The vacuum captures most (but not all) of the hair trimmings, it has a wide range of length settings, and battery holds a charge for a long enough time that it has never been a bother. However, there are some weaknesses. It is somewhat large (not the best for travel) and it has trouble with hair along the curve of my jawline and on the thinner, softer hair on my cheek. I do usually have to follow up with scissors to get a even cut. Also, it does not have numbered markings on the length settings, making it harder to reset the device to my preference if it gets out of adjustment.
  172. I recently purchased this trimmer after going through many bargain basement off the shelf beard trimmers. Uneven cuts, poor battery life, hair spraying in all directions, all of you bearded gentlemen out there know the drill. This time I did a little research and got the Phillips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer. The variable height cutting guard works well and the battery easily lasts a month on a charge for me. The vacuum works well in sucking up 95% of the trimmings and is easily cleaned. So far, the only issue is that the power control is a bit too easily activated when you are holding the unit in your hand, meaning that you can change your grip while trimming and accidentally turn the thing off. Also the power and turbo buttons are somewhat confusingly placed for my taste. What looks like a power button is the turbo button, so at first I picked the thing up and was stabbing at what I thought was the power button, and nothing was happening! I shifted my grip to look at the button at a different angle and, you guessed it, accidentally turned it on. Overall, a great trimmer, just watch you don't push the power switch too much!
  173. I have had several trimmers over the years, and while I'm still using this after 9 months, it isn't what I was hoping for. My biggest issues are as follows... The beard setting that determines the length of the beard can shift unknowingly to a shorter length as the trimmer is pressed to the face. Also this unit cannot trim the area of the mustache just beneath the nostrils - I still need to use scissors. Finally, it is not easy to remove the beard length piece to perform a close trim right above the lip. The door that holds the trimmed hair is a little delicate in my opinion and I'm always afraid I will break it. There is a little netted pouch inside the case that stuff gets caught in too.   179. I've been using beard trimmers for almost 30 years. This is the best so far. Light, powerful and very smooth. I had the prior version which was good, but not as good. I was surprised how much better this version is. The vacuum is much better, the alternate head for detailed trimming is easy to change back and forth, and the ability to use it plugged in is a big plus. The prior version could only be used in battery mode, and when the batteries wouldn't recharge after a couple years there was nothing to do but tear it open, recycle the batteries and throw the rest away (the batteries were soldered, so I couldn't just replace them). Norelco does recommend running the battery until the charge light comes on, and then recharging it (probably NiCad batteries), but this is no problem if you can use while charging. It also charges quickly and indicates when the charging is finished.<br />I shopped around, and Amazon's price (when I bought it) was the best around, online or in stores.

  190. Until recently, I had been using a Remington beard trimmer I had received as a Christmas gift from about 5 years ago. The Remington was good but it eventually just couldn't go any longer so I had to search for a new trimmer. I found the Phillips Norelco T980 fairly quickly and was impressed by the good reviews. And it didn't disappoint! The shipment came quick and I got to test it out (waited an hour for it to fully charge) to see how it would perform and perform it did! The shaver comes with 9 different preset trimming sizes so there is plenty of room for dynamic trimming. The flexible trim guard was something I immediately noticed and enjoyed, since my previous trimmer did not have this feature. In addition the flexibility really does allow you to get a precision trim really easily as it contours to the face great. The T980 comes with a 2 bristle (one soft, one hard) brush for cleaning out the clippers but what really is unique about this trimmer is the vacuum that is attached to it. The vacuum is made so that there is less of a clean up once your done trimming your beard, although it doesn't catch all the trimmings it did catch most of them and clean up was much faster than what I am used too. It also comes with a smaller clipper attachment for precision sculpting or just your run of the mill mustache trimming which is slid on and off with ease. The shaver also comes with a Turbo Mode but the only thing this really does that I have noticed is give the vacuum more power, it may also speed up the clippers but I am not sure about that it seems to clip nicely whether the Turbo Mode is on or off. I think because of the vacuum this trimmer seems a bit louder during operation than my last trimmer but by no means is it a chainsaw (haha). Finally, the trimmer comes with a travel bag for easy storage on trips which I thought was thoughtful. The only qualm I had was the packaging...it comes in a really sturdy clam shell package and with no helpful opening tabs so it could take you at least a few minutes to get everything out without cutting yourself on sharp plastic edges but since that has nothing to do with the performance of the trimmer I wont go on about that. So all in all, this trimmer is a fine replacement; dare I say upgrade to my last trimmer, it is said, \\"You get what you pay for\\" well, with the Norelco T980 I think you may be getting that and then some! Precision trimming, ease of use, and convenient clean up and features makes this shaver a must buy for any man especially those on the job hunt!
  191. I have been using this product for the past couple of years and just love it. It has a superb cut & a nice vacuum for the droppings.

  193. The Philips Norelco T980 is a very good beard and hair trimmer. The motor is strong, giving a very even cut. The vacuum function works very well capturing the clippings easily. The only negative is that the cutting blade is inset too far into the head making it very difficult to trim close to the nose. Lip, chin, and jaw are no problem, but the area just under the nose has to have special attention with scissors.

  195. Received this trimmer and went right to the instruction book. (I learned to check this out first) Don't recharge this NiCad Battery unless its totally discharged because you will damage the battery by recharging every time you use it and don't leave it plugged in either. Just charge it when it quits that is all!! Took a little looking to find the rotating ring that sets the height (or depth) of the hair but it works fine. I found that I look better if I use two heights for different areas. I like the two speed and I Love the vacuum for not leaving hair everywhere. After using it I can't imagine using anything that does not clean up after itself (vacuum that is) I am very satisfied.

  197. Had this trimmer for 2 years and it died last week after sliding into the bathroom sink under running water....<br /><br />While it was working it was a good trimmer overall, though I really didn't like have to switch out the trimmer heads for the standard and then the detail sized cutters--on more than one occasion I was in a hurry and fumbling around looking for the other cutter assembly than what was on the trimmer. Another issue was that it was relatively easy to move the height adjustment by accident when taking off and replacing the plastic trimmer guard, which you need to do in order to switch cutting heads. It wasn't a really big deal, but a lot of times I wouldn't remember which number I had the hair length set on, and then I would have to guess what setting I had it one the last time I used it.....The vacuum feature was nice I guess in that it doesn't get too many little beard trimmings all over the sink, but then again it's really easy to just turn on the sink and rinse it, or, use the trimmer over a rug where you'll never see the small trimmings.....<br /><br />But the big lesson here is to be sure buy a wet/dry beard trimmer that won't die if it gets a little wet. I just bought the Panasonic ER224S All-in-One Cordless Hair and Beard Trimmer [[ASIN:B000F4USF8 Panasonic ER224S All-in-One Cordless Hair and Beard Trimmer (Silver)]] which was almost half the price of the Phillips Norelco unit and it's a wet/dry trimmer that you can use in the shower. It also has a built-in detail trimmer so you don't have to switch cutter heads and worry about loosing attachments. When I went to replace the T980 that died, I avoided the latest Phillips/Norelco version because I think a wet/dry is beard trimmer is really the only way to go. So far I really like the Panasonic, and I wish I had bought one of these to start with.......

  199. I've always heard that Norelco is the best, but the T980 turbo vacuum trimmer is a little disappointing. It doesn't cut any closer than my piece-of-$#%& Remington trimmer (I think the stubble is actually a bit longer) though it is much MUCH faster and more comfortable to use. The vacuum is a nice feature, it simplifies cleanup. The guide comb is almost a necessity, this is the only electric trimmer I've managed to cut myself with. Overall, not a bad trimmer if you don't expect the impossible of it...the close shave of a razor with the convenience of an electric.
  200. Of the trimmers I have used (have been through several brands), this one does a good job for the price. The vacuum does help reduce the cleanup, so that is helpful. It holds its charge well and gives sufficient warning when it is time to charge the unit. All beards are a bit different and this shave has a problem with the hairs just below my jawline. The hairs generally grow up toward the ear and this thing, on \\"Turbo\\" or not cannot cut them. With some success, I use a lower trim level, but generally, I need to do dangerous manual cleanup with the edger attachment. For my beard, at this price, I accept the extra work but will consider a different model/brand when it is time to buy another.
  201. The packaging was extremly difficult to open....but overall the shaver is good quality and works great!
  202. Not too bad but could be better. Instructions stink. Haven't owned it long so maybe it will get better with age.
  203. This is my first beard (mustaches aplenty over the years before now), and I used the reviews here to select a beard trimmer. It's a decent product for the price and seems to work well.
  204. I bought this for my husband, who's very picky about his shavers and trimmers. The last one we had was a Wahl and he was pretty adamant about getting the exact same trimmer but it was discontinued. I settled on getting him this Norelco trimmer because of the vacuum feature, something he really liked in the Wahl. He does really like it. The vacuum suction works great and there's little residue hairs that are left on my bathroom counter, something I really like. The power is good too. The only thing about this trimmer is that it's bigger, pretty significantly, compared to the Wahl. That's why I gave it four stars instead of five. Overall, as long as it works well, he shouldn't have a problem. He likes it.

Workd great for me - I use the Norelcon to avoid having to have a \\"clean shave\\" every day - I call it the \\"Festus Look - he was a character on The TV show Gunsmoke that never had a beard but also was never clean shaven - so I set my Noreelcon toi #3 and get a beard that is about 1/4 inch everwhere.   210. I have used various trimmers but this is the best i have ever used. I am a very happy and satisfied customer. I read some reviews before buying it and I am glad I made the right decision. Although there were some negative reviews about the trimmer not functioning properly or leaving a mess unless you start the turbo mode but I never saw that happening with me. I have been using the normal mode and it just works fine, no mess over my sink, only a little bit here and there and i understand this is not a vacuum cleaner, its a trimmer and as a matter of fact i dont even use turbo mode, its just not required. for trimming quality, i read someone saying it can't hold the levels and slides down to 1 if you apply even a little pressure but its all wrong, probably they don't know how to use a trimmer correctly. Just to check this, I deliberately applied enough pressure on levels 2 and 3, hard enough to punch my face with it but the trimmer stayed at the selected level, did not slid down to 1, probably i was not hammering it into my face as other guys did, lol. one charging gives me 2 weeks easily, now the deal is, i dont have full beard, i use it to trim my french beard and sometimes use it on armpits but anyways this is not something one should be worrying about since I can use it while its charging and plugged in. finally, the smaller attachment it comes with, I just love that one, thank god someone thought about creating it, it helps me alot giving shape to my beard and maintaining the length of hair. If I see a couple of strands growing too big, i can use it and I dont have to risk it with the long 2 inch trimmer blades i have used earlier. overall, i am satisfied to the core. its a 5 on 5 from my side.
  211. The device works pretty good. I use it to just keep my beard under control. The vacuum wasn't as good as I expected, since it still misses a few hairs. The carrying case is pretty useful for the price its worth it

I would recommend this item to anyone.

  220. This was bought for our son as a gift. He has only used it a few times but he likes it now.
  221. The trimmer works great. I especially like the adjustable settings that are easy to change. Would highly recommend. The turbo vac feature is wonderful and eliminates the clippings fro going everywhere.
  222. I must say that I disagree with most reviewers on this product. I have several problems with the design which I would like to share. First, a disclaimer. The product title says that it is a hair \\"trimmer\\" and not a \\"clipper\\". Perhaps I did not see the distinction at first, but I see that others purchase this unit as a clipper as well. So, as a trimmer (used very frequently and with very short hair trimmings) this unit may work for you. But even as a trimmer, if the hair is cut at any length (and there are 9 settings to the guide), this thing is useless. First, the \\"on\\" and \\"turbo\\" buttons are too easy to push while handling, and I'm constantly startling myself with the turbo setting (it is a little loud). Also, I find that the guide/vacuum design is poor. This may work OK if you are trimming short guide settings, but if you get a clump of hair in the guide, which happens constantly with me, it will block the tiny opening for the hair cup. The vacuum is not strong enough to pull the hair in, and it clogs the whole works. If you do not notice this, the blockage will prevent the trimmer from trimming, and you may think that a lower guide setting is needed. You can see how this sets you up for a scalp job when the low guide setting is finally low enough to make a cut. I just find the whole set up \\"gimmicky\\" and I will take the old standard guides and no vacuum any day. It does have a strong battery and if you are just lightly trimming a mustache or a beard, it may be the right choice for you. I think people like me would not be disappointed (and would not have purchased the product) if it had been called the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Beard and Mustache Vacuum Trimmer. Long title, but descriptive enough to avoid purchasing the wrong product.
  223. I purchased the T980 after my old Norelco died and I found they no longer made it. The T980 does as good a job as my old one with one exception-the safety shield makes it a little more difficult to trim the edge of my mustache. Other than that it is a great trimmer. It would have been nice if it had come with a charging base rather that a cord but the charge lasts so long it really isn't a problem. I highly recommend this trimmer for both it's performance and very reasonable cost.
  224. This trimmer works well, i always use it on turbo mode just because it cuts and sucks more hair. i will note that if you are cutting off a lot of long beard hair it will miss more than if you do it regularly and trim short hair more frequently. other than that seems to work perfectly.
  225. I was apprehensive about buying an expensive trimmer, and wondered if a less expensive one would do the job of just keeping the goatee that I wanted to just the right length - just a stubble length. I did buy some cheaper models, but they turned out woefully bad, so much that I dropped the idea of keeping a goatee and just went with clean shaven for a while. But then I read all the great things that I read on this and decided to go for it. BEST PURCHASE !! I can have just the right length of trim that I want, in fact, I found that the shortest trim is a bit too short, it just gives the 5 o'clock shadow - so if thats the look you want, you wont be disappointed !! I use the # 2 length setting, and thats just right for a stubble - just enough to feel, but too short to actually grip any of the hairs.<br /><br />I love the vaccuum feature, and although its not perfect vaccuum, you have to shave over the sink if you dont want stray bits of hair on the floor.. few hairs do escape the vaccuum, but use the trimmer for a few weeks and then check out the chamber, you would be surprised how much has been caught in. the fine trimmer attachment is ok, not so great to do the fine lines of a goatee, I got to do it quite a few times, but then I suspect nothing will ever come close to the perfection a blade can offer. This is as good as it gets !<br /><br />Go for it, you wont be disappointed.
  226. Without question, an excellent product! I'm very impressed. I like to keep a short goatee - a bit longer than the \\"stubble look.\\" I set my T980 on number \\"2\\" and - voilá! Very cool indeed. The device does vacuum most of the beard, but not all. Anyhow, the sink clean up afterwards takes a lot less time. What's also impressive is the battery life. I used my T980 about 2 to 3 times a week for a fast trim and did not need to re-charge it since I first got it, which was a few weeks ago. As I write this review, I have to re-charge it again for just about an hour. The T980 comes with accessories and its own storage pouch. I would buy this product again as a gift for someone else.

  232. I purchased the Philips Norelco 7980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer a couple of weeks ago and really like it. It does indeed capture pretty much all of the cut hair which saves clean-up time afterwards. And the turbo feature does work, kicking up the speed much faster to trim you beard in no time. The only downside, and a small one at that, was the learning curve for figuring out how to take off and replace the different heads but that's no longer a problem. Buy it, you'll like it!
  233. I bought this to replace my Remington MB400 trimmer which I really liked. Unfortunately, after years of use, the battery will no longer hold a charge for more then a couple minutes. That's unfortunate because the titanium blades still cut well. I liked the MB400, because it gave me a close stuble shave, its vacuum worked well and it stood upright, taking up less space on my small sink. Since this model is no longer available, (I would have bought it again), and since Remington, no longer offers a vacuum trimmer for some odd reason, I had to look elsewhere. I was somewhat reluctant to buy the Norelco T980, because I had Norelco rotary razor years ago which I hated. However, I chalked that up to not liking the rotary system and this trimmer had some good reviews. The trimmer is a sleek black color, comes with a carrying case, and in general looks well built. The battery much to its credit also holds a charge well. I've used it multiple times and I still haven't had to recharge it yet. The trimmer has been a disappoint overall though, mainly because unlike my previous trimmer it does not provide a close stuble shave. This may be a non issue for some buyers if they are only looking to trim longer hair, however it is a critical issue for me as I tend to use my trimmer as my primary shaver, and keep a seperate foil shaver for days I need a cleaner shave. This trimmer simply does not cut close enough with either of the provided heads. The smaller trimmer head also cuts rough and felt more uncomfortable. The vacuum works well, but the blue collection piece gets in the way when shaving, and also causes the vacuum to miss some. The plastic collection door on front front flips open, but stays hinged and thus gets in the way, when you are trying to empty hair. The blue turbo button on front changes the whir of the motor, but I didn't notice any difference in shave. Overall, this is probably a decent to good trimmer for longer hair lengths, but if you are looking for anything nearing a close shave, avoid this model. I will be getting a different model due to the closeness issue.
  234. I've had this product for something like 3 years now and finally thought I'd write a review. I love it. Others have stated quite clearly it's benefits, which I fully agree with. So, I'm going to focus on the long-term (minor) issues I've had just so you know. a) After about 2 years, the trimmings basket (the plastic container your hair gets sucked into) came apart. I used some crazy glue to fix it and it's been fine since. b) It's sometimes hard to get the guard back on on the head, takes some finesse. And that, my friends, is really it. The vacuum really works but you gotta have turbo on. My girlfriend no longer has to deal with hair in the sink. It does a great job on my beard (I like it short, I'm a #2), and it's even fine for my neck (YMMV). Best beard trimmer I've ever owned in 15 years.
  235. I enjoyed this trimmer at first, though I should say that it never cut as closely to my skin as I wanted it too. But after a year, the motor started jumping and though it works, it doesn't work as well.
  236. I've had a beard for over 35 years and used various trimmers and shapers including Norelco.   240. I bought this trimmer to replace the one that I had purchased a few years back. The old one never failed, I simply plugged it into the wall on a trip to Europe during a lapse in judgment. Its various settings are easy to work with, give you enough range for whatever length you're looking for, and the closest setting will give you the short stubble length that is very short. The best part is that with the vacuum action, there's no mess to clean up around the sink - and it works. The only thing I'm not thrilled about in the redesign is that they've replaced the pull-out canister that holds the clippings with a small door that swings open and you empty - which I suspect won't last long unless you're pretty careful.I'm wary of the plastic hinge. Still, that doesn't keep me from giving this trimmer five stars. It has a long battery life too - you'll only need to charge it once every ten or fifteen uses, which means you can travel with it charged and not risk burning it with 220V.
  241. It really works quite well. I had another brand before this and I must say this one is much nicer and it works great. I trim my beard and cut my hair with it and it does a great job.   242. I'm a repeat Norelco user. Having read some of the other reviewers' complaints of \\"excessive noise\\" and \\"soft\\" depth settings, and considering the somewhat vague description of the T980 Turbo, I was hesitant, but bought it anyway.<br /><br />I'm happy to say the T980 is an improvement in every way over my old faithful trimmer (T970 maybe? I threw it away after a couple of days with this one). I'd used my old trimmer for over 3 years with no problems whatsoever. The old battery was weakening, and when I saw the Philips special promotion on Amazon, I decided it was time for an upgrade.<br /><br />Here's the lowdown: Most important to folks wondering whether to upgrade- the T980 works EXACTLY like the old one; you can still pop the top off and do the edge trimming without adding any attachments; No. 3 and No. 2 depth on this one are the same as on the old one, etc.<br /><br />As for noise, my old trimmer had no doubt gotten noisier over the years as the blades dulled or whatever, but with them side by side, the T980 was noticeably QUIETER right out of the box. On the \\"turbo screamer\\" setting, it was about even with the old one as far as pure decibels. Speaking of the turbo setting, it's a neat idea, but the vacuum on this one works so much better than the previous one on \\"normal,\\" in practice I never even switch it to \\"turbo.\\"<br /><br />The depth adjustment on the T980 does have a slightly soft \\"click\\" right out of the box, but contrary to what I've read, it holds the setting at least as firmly as my old one. Plus, once I used it a few weeks, it loosened up and now \\"clicks\\" as definitively as the old one ever did.<br /><br />If you're using an older Norelco trimmer similar to this one and have been pleased with it, I can recommend the upgrade to the T980 without hesitation.
  243. This product is really cool one from Phillips. It is easy to use and trimming nicely.... I am so happy.
  244. I'd been wanting a trimmer with a vacuum option on it, so when I was buying some other new trimmers and shavers, I decided to get this one too. I have to say in some ways I don't like it as much as the plain Norelco trimmer it replaced, but I'll give it 4 stars because the main reason I bought this, for the vacuum, works very well. Didn't even use the turbo option, the counter-top looks a lot cleaner after a shave now. The back of the trimmer guide looks odd, but it works fine. My biggest knock is when you take the guide off. There's a sliding plastic panel that I guess is there to help direct hair into the vacuum, but it makes trimming without the guide a bit of a pain. I used to use my old trimmer to trim my mustache, but I'll probably use the trimmer on my shaver for that now, it's less work even though I have to reach for a second gadget. Using the trimmer without the guide though to try to shape the sides of my beard was a little bit of a hassle, though I've only used the trimmer once, so maybe with some experimentation it will get easier. Anyway, the vacuum part of it certainly works well.

  246. This unit replaces a T990 in which the battery died much too early.   249. If you plan to travel outside the USA make sure you have a full charge and do not run out of juice while away. It is strange this day and age that products come with 110-120v transformers one vs. 110-240v; esp. personal care items like shavers and trimmers. If you run out of power when in Europe (say) plan to have to take a AC adapter or buy a new adapter while overseas. You get a reasonable use time before re-charging, but ever now and again you will have a situation where your trimmer or shaver gets turned on while packed tight in your luggage - then you will be out of luck.
  250. I really like this trimmer, it trims my beard evenly in much less time then my last trimmer, and while it does not pick up ALL the hair that falls, it picks up enough to make clean-up very easy.
  251. Having used this item for several weeks, I can attest to it's excellent performance. Although I am not sure why you need a turbo button, when it seems to me it should be on full vacuum all the time, it is an excellent beard and mustache trimmer/shaver. Perhaps a little big, but not heavy. Simple to use, and many hair length settings. I have no reservation in recommending this one.
  252. I got mine around three weeks ago. The good news is that it cuts my beard well, and the vacuum is not noisy. The bad news is 1) the controls are positioned such that I find myself accidently hitting the on/off switch as I am shaving, no huge deal but annoying, 2) the vacuum action catches 95% of the hairs but 95% means you still have to clean up afterwards so it is of dubious value, and most importantly 3) it does not hold its distance setting. I find that, as I shave, the shave length setting can very easily be pushed down so that I end up with a much shorter beard than I intended. I can't imagine why after all these years Norelco has not come up with a better system for locking down the shave length so that it does not get changed by the mere act of shaving. In my opinion this last issue makes it a dud product that fails at its intended function, and I would recommend against buying it.
  253. The trimmer works perfectly in every sense. The only thing that kills it is the fact that they decided to include an AC adapter that only works with 120 volts. In other words, if you travel, you can't charge this trimmer in most other countries. I don't think it's that much more expensive to include an adapter that accepts 110-230 volts. My last Norelco trimmer that lasted 7 years could accept 110-230 volts and was always with me in my travels. Items such as trimmers, shavers, cell phones, laptops, etc. all should accept 110-230 volts, since they are mostly travel items.

He's really picky about his clippers and trimmer, and he said he loves it and it works great.
  266. My old T965's battery gave up after 4 faithful years of service. The problems with the new T980 are: the new body is a hard slick plastic which is more difficult to grip (slips out of the hand); the small/fine trimmer is now an attachment. That means you've got this small trimmer head that you have to keep in the medicine cabinet or when you travel in a safe place where you won't lose it; the depth indicator is hard to read and the numbers aren't always centered in the tiny viewing window. Philips has now replaced the old standard coiled power cords with specialized adapters. This means when you're on vacation you've got to bring the AC adapter for your face trimmer and then bring a different AC adapter for your beard trimmer. Pros: It looks real pretty. It cuts well.
  267. This is my second trimmer. My first, a Remington was at least 15 years old and worked like a champ. It had it's problems like many of these in holding the desired length. But you learn to hold it tight so it won't change while trimming. I babied the batteries for years and quite honestly if you don't, with Ni-Cads you'll be replacing them or the trimmer a lot sooner.<br /><br />I like this one and was concerned by some of the negative reviews. I don't use a lot of pressure when trimming so I haven't seen it change (shorten) while trimming. The vacuum feature is nice and works well. Others complained about getting up under the nose. This is no different from any others I've tried that use a blade guard.<br /><br />I'd give it 5 stars if I had it longer. So far so good and has lived up to or beyond my expectations. I'm still on the first charge so time will tell. If it lasts half as long as my Remington I'll be happy.
  268. This trimmer does a wonderful job keeping my beard looking great. The only reason I didn't give it the full five stars is that it doesn't vacuum up all the beard trimmings. It allows for a nice range of beard lengths as long as you don't want it too long. But if you want anything from the popular \\"haven't shaved for a day or two\\" look to a full but nicely trimmed beard, this will do it.
  269. After 3, almost identical, super-solid, Panasonic trimmers over the past twenty years, they discontinued the model. This Norelco seemed to be the best non-pro model available, but it is quite different. Not terrible but it takes some getting used to. Power and battery life are fine, the vacuum feature is strange. Be careful the first few times, it does not seem to be doing anything because no hairs are flying around, but rest assured it is cutting. Because of the vacuum, you cannot do close trimming with the main head and switching heads is a pain. I can't imagine what it is like for people who buy trimmers with 3 or more interchangable heads. The T980 is OK, but I long for the old days. One head, one adjustable comb. Everything handled.
  270. Bought this to replace a T765 that I wore out after 5 years. I like that this T980 has the vacuum feature. Not 100% effective but way better than nothing. Keeps most of the trimmings out of the sink so it's easier to clean up the sink after trimming...the wife likes that feature! A bit bulky but easy to control and gives a nice accurate trim. It's a good value and if it's like my last Norelco it should last many years. I give it a 4 1/2. Buy it!
  271. I *borrowed* this from my man after my own wimpy, girly trimmer broke. I won't give it back to him.<br /><br />I like my bikini area to be well groomed and this does the trick easily and leaves no itchy cut hairs behind afterward like my other trimmer did. It does a very through job and I know I will not get nicked or cut no matter what angle I use it at because of the way the hair guard is made (nice feature). Easy to make length adjustments and easy to clean. This one is a keeper for the ladies.<br /><br />Why oh why do they not make well engineered things like this for women's body grooming needs?? Why do we have to go sneaking around borrowing decent trimmers from our men or have to go to a salon to get groomed?<br />Norelco take note... this is a great product that women would love if they only knew it existed.<br /><br />*UPDATE* 12/8/08.... Since I wrote my review, the little cup that holds the cut hairs has broken open twice. It is easy enough to superglue it back together, but it is a design flaw that you must grab the cup right at the seam in order to open it and empty it. Tiny hairs go all over when it breaks... it is annoying.<br />That being said, I still LOVE this trimmer and would buy it again, but be careful when you are emptying out the cup and possibly think about only opening it over the trash can just in case.
  272. Product received in non-working condition. It would not turn on. Return from Amazon was a non-issue, easily handled.
  273. This beard trimmer is a big improvement over Norelco's earlier version (which used to be the best beard trimmer on the market). Look no further!
  274. I was a little concerned after reading a few of the negative reviews. Nonetheless, I decided to go with this trimmer, it had a lot more positive reviews than negative and it was the most expensive trimmer on amazon at the time and I was looking for a high quality trimmer. After a few uses I quickly realized why some of the negative reviews said the trimmer didn't trim. I recall one guy saying he was pressing super hard but it didn't trim any hair. So here's the scoop, the plastic guard/head if improperly seated on the top of the trimmer stands 1/2 - 1 inch higher than it should. Thus on virtually any setting, the trimmer part isn't touching your face. This is not a big deal, properly seating the guard on the device is pretty simple. For me the battery on the trimmer has lasted about 25-35 trims of the my full beard. I don't use the turbo vacuum feature as I heard that it runs the batteries out quicker and it doesn't seem like it's needed anyway. I keep my beard pretty short and the vacuum under normal power does the job. The device has 10 length settings and an extra trimming pieces to do clean-up type work. It doesn't make that much noise (when the turbo button is not on) and it is a very light device. I think the overall size of the device is \\"just right\\". It's feels comfortable using it and it's not overly large which would make for awkward use. The only suggestion I'd have for Norelco is to beef up the friction on the length adjuster. While using the device a few times the length setting moved to a lower setting unintentionally. All in all I am extremely satisfied with this trimmer. For not a lot of $ I feel like I bought the best trimmer that was available on the market.
  275. OK. Let's just say that I'm looking for the perfect cut, without going to the barber shop. The Norelco T980 is good, but, it doesn't completely live up to the claims on the product details. Yes, it does have a turbo button that acts like a facial hair trimmer NOS booster. However, the blades don't seem to make a perfect cut. Even after spending considerable time, I still have the wild hair or two left that requires special attention. The vacuum, unlike how it is described, does NOT pick up all of the hair being cut. In fact, you'll find your sink littered with remains after even the briefest of jobs. All of this said, I've used a few other trimmers in the past and this is one of the best. One more thing, the device feels light (and a bit cheap).
  276. Doesn't work as good as professional trimmers, but doesn't cost as much either. As far as what it's designed to do, I don't think the turbo feature works any better than normal mode. It still drops a lot of hair in my sink in either mode. I have to go over an area a few times to remove all the hair no matter which mode I'm using. All in all, the T980 works OK but not great.
