  280. The mechanical tech department at Norelco have produced another fine shaver/trimmer mechanism. Unfortunately the sales department has downgraded quality by packaging the trimmer with a cheap recharging system.<br /><br />Most high end rechargeable items nowadays can be left in the recharging base constantly, always ready for use. Not this thing. The user directions warn that it must be charged no longer than 24 hours. What happens if you forget? Perhaps this item would not dangerously overheat, maybe it would just lessen the life of the batteries. Who can predict what bad things might happen?<br /><br />Other cautions in Norelco's documentation: \\"... do not recharge trimmer between trimming sessions. Continue using it until the battery is completely empty\\". And then twice a year you are advised to run down the batteries completely to condition them. The batteries in some other devices (which use other chemistry) do not require any of these special maintenance routines to remember. Those trimmers are nice to own, compared to this one.<br /><br />If this thing had a base, then the base could be placed far from the sink for safety in using AC around water. On those mornings when the batteries run down you will plug in the cord and therefore be using AC. Since there is no base its tempting to just lay it down anywhere.<br /><br />Comparing the shroud around the cutters, its exactly the same size and looks very much like my old Norelco. But this one has the shroud's plastic teeth cut in the middle so that the head can \\"float\\". Bah! Humbug! That cut reduces stiffness and the plastic teeth are now in two pieces, each of which is attached on only one end! This allows the shroud teeth to bend inward on the end where they are not attached. When this happens it will cut the whiskers *really* shorter and that part of your beard will look funny at work a couple days. Yes it happened to me first time I used it. I was used to my older Norelco with teeth which were not bendable, but dependable.<br /><br />The on/off switch is right on top, and a light touch will cycle it. Wonderful! Now when you travel you pray that the thing isn't running when you go through airport security. How hot would it get in the suitcase if it does come on and run 45 minutes? My old Norelco had a stiff rotating switch that could never cycle on/off unexpectedly.<br /><br />As for how well it trims, on a scale 1 to 10, I would say 10. That is, when using a very lighter touch than what I'm used to so that the teeth do not compress and sculpture the result.f switch is right on top, and a light touch will cycle it. Wonderful! Now when you travel you pray that the thing isn't running when you go through airport security. How hot would it get in the suitcase if it does come on and run 45 minutes? My old Norelco had a stiff rotating switch that could never cycle on/off unexpectedly. As for how well it trims, on a scale 1 to 10, I would say 10. That is, when using a very lighter touch than what I'm used to so that the teeth do not compress and sculpture the result.
  281. This is by far the greatest trimmer I have ever own, love the Turbo , no hairs anywhere, works great
  282. For a Philips Norelco product, it was only so-so. I subsequently bought a Wahl product and found it to be much better.
  283. I've always been a believer in correct battery \\"training.\\" If your unit (phone, laptop or in this case, shaver) spends every night on the cradle or sucking juice from your home or apartment, odds are that battery will suffer. This suffering will take down its operating ability and cause the charge to last less each time you use it. I've trained my battery correctly from the start (turn it on and leave it to expend itself when I opened the box and then give it the first good, solid nights charge). I enjoy the trimmer, love that I can walk around my room and clean my beard without spilling shards of dead cells everywhere.
  284.   285. I was incredibly excited to get this trimmer. I previously had a Norelco Trimmer that I absolutely loved and thought worked wonderful. After a few years of use the battery didn't hold much charge and I finally lost the charger after traveling! I looked at the trimmers available and the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer sounded great. I was a little worried about purchasing it however because I read some users were having problems with the trimming guard moving position. I thought I'd give it a try and if it didn't work, I'd send it back... and ultimately I was hoping the people having troubles were just incompetent. I charged the trimmer for a day. Played around with the trimming guard by pushing on it and moving it up and down and it seemed to be extremely solid and sturdy. It seemed like it locked in position just fine. After starting to trim on a safe level 6 (my goatie had gotten long, waiting for a new trimmer) I was having success. While gliding the trimmer up the side of my goatie, WHOOPS, it slipped to Level 4. Oh well, I said, I guess I'm going to have a level 4 goatie. Well to sum it up, about halfway into it I was surprised with a slip to level 2. The vacuum is wonderful, it works perfectly. But honestly, do you really give a crap if you have to shave at a level 2 every stinking time? Why didn't I send it back? The package was impossible to open, I had to cut and rip it in shreds. It's hard to go without a trimmer but PLEASE read this review and know that you WILL have problems with it slipping trim guards, I guarantee it. The design of the trim guard dial is part of the problem. I'm not going to sit here and tell Philips how to design a trimmer though, they've done it correctly in the past. BOTTOM LINE: Great idea, new innovations work great, but as a trimmer this is a piece of junk because you can't shave at any level higher than a number 2 without risk of ending up 2 levels lower or MORE.

  302. This beard/head trimmer works as you might hope it would. I had purchased, about 3 years ago, a version of the same trimmer and the battery eventually stopped holding a charge for very long. The old version was an AccuVac T870. I got another trimmer to replace the old one and it did not have the \\"Vacuum\\" part and my wife was not happy about the \\"little hairs all over\\" (even after I tried to clean up) -- so I returned that one and looked for a similar one to my old one. That is when I found this one on Amazon and got it. Great upgrade from the \\"older one\\" I had. Every feature I liked from the old one is still there but it has been improved in many ways as well. The old one took 12 hrs. to charge and this one takes 70 min. The adjustment \\"clicker\\" (how close to trim) is firmer, so there is less chance of it moving on you while you trim (making for a shorter than expected cut at times - a risk with the older one). What totally amazed me is after the first initial charge (following instructions) I let it drain the battery until it indicated it was time for a charge (neat new flashy light thingy does that), but it let me use the trimmer for full trim (I do my head and my beard) about 6 - 7 times before it needed to be re charged. This one also says it can be used while plugged in. The previous version never said it could be and I used it that way at times which may have compromised the battery for the old one. Now I feel fine using it plugged or unplugged since the instructions say it's OK. I like it, no more \\"little hairs all over\\" -- of course a few leak out here and there, but I usually do a good enough job to keep my wife happy with a little wipe down around the sink, etc. after trimming. I don't even use the \\"Turbo\\" switch but perhaps if I did there would be no hairs around at all. Good Product, get one. I really like mine.

  320. This trimmer is a well designed and manufactured gadget. The hair length selector is firm to adjust but the guide comb wiggles slightly front to back when raised. I like to use a dust remover air can to blast the excess hair away. The Turbo works well although there's no need for it. It adds about 30-50% more speed (you decide) and 100% more noise. The power cord attaches quite snuggly in the bottom so no worries about it falling out. Although not flawless this is hands down the best beard trimmer I've ever owned.

  322. I really wanted to love this trimmer. Especially given the hefty price tag. It trims as you would expect and the vacuum works well and is a must-have feature in my opinion. Another must have feature is either Ni-Mh battery or the more expensive Lithium ion battery. This has Neither it is the bad/cheapo/old Ni-Cad (Nickel Cadmium) with all the memory effects and shortened life span that implies. For a device like this where you can't swap the battery yourself and you can't leave the job half done you will have to partially charge and then finish your trim. Then you will recharge it fully, boom instant battery memory and shortened life. Or maybe you re-charge it after every use? That may be even worse... I've been through this before, you are doomed to a useful life measured in months before the battery (and therefore the whole trimmer) craps out. I researched on line and couldn't discover what type of battery it was so I went in person to my local WM and looked at the packaging, still no hint. So I bought it thinking they couldn't possibly sell it at such a high price point with such an unsuitable battery. I got it home and found in the instructions that the battery is Ni-Cad and soldered into place and must be disposed of properly. I'll be returning it and looking for a different vacuum trimmer with a battery that will be useful for longer than a few months.
  323. First trimmer I've used. No complaints. Hair at the top of the upper lip is difficult to reach with the main trimmer, but put on the mini-trimmer attachment (which takes about 5 seconds) and it's a breeze. I've had no problem with it trimming an improper length or accidentally changing the setting while trimming. You have to be holding it really awkwardly for that to happen. Bottom line, this will help you keep your facial hair looking well-groomed.
  324. I purchased this to replace my old Norelco, only because the batteries died and they could not be replaced. So I made sure to pick a model that could be used by either recharging or plugged in directly. The vacuum is nice, the turbo is nice, but I got it because of the adjustable cutting length and the ease of use. It's nicer than my old Norelco, and it even trims a little better too :)
  325. Purchased back in 11/06. I use it about once a week. My concern with these types of items is will they hold up. So far this trimmer is holding up very well. The vacuum is definitely worth the extra money. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
  326. I've been using this one for two years and I have loved it. But I must say the battery is still old-fashioned Ni-Cad and the product itself hasn't been updated in years. Come on, in this day and age you can't get away with not changing a design for three years.
  327. I have used this trimmer three or four times now, and it works well for me. I have a full beard, which I trim for length. I also trim the mustache, to keep it out of my mouth. The trimmer does all this just fine. The selection of lengths is good for me; I keep my beard fairly short (#6). I found the vacuum to be well worth while, to my surprise. It collects all the trimmings very well, and does not leave lots of stray hairs on my shirt.[[ASIN:B000FED5D0 Philips Norelco T780 Rechargeable Vacuum Trimmer]]
  328. It made me WANT to shave, which is amazing. It is easy to clean up, very smooth, very easy, very affordable, very cool looking, and very powerful. Basically, if you want a really good beard trimmer, this is what you want. You just need to make sure to charge it after it arrives, because it is sort of weak (very powerful, especially with the TURBO BUTTON, but not as powerful).

  330. Being that my previous Norelco trimmer (a T770) took 10 hours to fully charge, I greatly liked how the T980 took just 70 minutes to do the same thing. And I just LOVE the mini-beard trimmer attachment!! Now I can trim my beard line, mustache and sideburn hair (with the help of vacuum power) without having to worry about a HUGE mess to clean up!! And the turbo power option? The 30% increase in vacuum power it provides helps out in situations where you have to hold the T980 in contorted, odd positions to get the job done (i.e. upside down), and you don't want hair that's being cut coming out of the device. In short, the Norelco T980 is a BIG improvement over the trimmer that I used to have!! And the price was pretty damn reasonable, too!! I definitely feel that I got my money's worth when I purchased this product!!
  331. I got this for my husband for Christmas, but it was more for me than for him because I was tired of cleaning up his beard hairs from around the sink when he was done trimming. The vacuum works well it picked up about 90% of the hair. Another added bennifit is that my husband said the vacuum seems to make the hair stand up better just before it's cut so it makes a more clean and efficient trim than his last one. His last one was a norelco too. The one downfall of this one is that the plastic guard is far enough from the cutter that it stops him from getting a good trim right under the nose, but that is the same with all trimmers depending on what length setting you have it on. Overall we have been very pleased with this trimmer.
  332. I used to have an old Norelco trimmer that used for years until it just wouldn't charge anymore and bought this as the \\"new and improved\\" replacement and for the most part . . . it is. Here is the short: Pros: Classic Design, Same quality and function, powerful vacum Cons: Not good for trimming to skin w/o Guard. The Long: Its form, design and cut remind me of my old Norelco (which is great) with only one major difference, the vacuum. In order for the vacum to work there is a plastic vacum \\"sleeve\\" or \\"guard\\" that goes up to the teeth. The other reviewers complained about close trimming without the full guard and I do agree that it is awkward to pull down the vacuum sleeve for a close trim but I found that on both this model and my old one, the teeth on the trimmer were too big for a comfortable close trim anyway, so I do not use that feature. I instead use a fine tooth slid-up trimmer on another shaver for that. I disagree with the noise complaints, I thought the vacuum was only slightly louder than the actual trimmer and there was plenty of suction at the lower setting, which you can't hear over the trimmer. Overall, a great classic Norelco trimmer.
  333. I bought this mainly to use on my beard, which grows quickly. Overall, I like it. It's not the best (most powerful) trimmer I've ever had, but its other features make up for what it lacks in power. The adjustable comb is easy to use and I don't have to dig through the drawer in the bathroom to find a snap-on #3 comb I like to use and therefore always lose. The vacuum feature is nice and makes cleaning up small jobs easier, especially since I don't have to sweep hair off a wet sink afterwards. Cleaning is straightforward as all the pieces come apart and go back together pretty easily. The turbo feature is also helpful. My beard is very coarse, and tends to jam up most trimmers. This one gets hung up sometimes, but if I go slowly and don't try to cut too much at once, it works fine. One note: The hair \\"reservoir\\" under the vacuum fills up quickly, so it's better to use this more often on smaller jobs than waiting to do a bigger trim.
  334. Had this for about 2 years now and its pretty good. It has a nice vacuum feature but some hairs still escape the vacuum, but it's beats cleaning up the entire sink! What I like most about it is the option to plug in to AC directly and not have to wait for the charge. Probably the best trimmer out there from what I researched. Two years later still don't have the same features for new trimmers. Buy one.
  335. This is a great way to trim your beard. A definite step up from traditional trimmers. The magic in it is the vacuum that captures and stores trimmed beard and mustache hair instead of letting it fall into your sink to make a mess. You don't make your lady mad, and everyone is happy.<br /><br />The trimmer itself fits comfortably in your hand. It has an detachable cord that allows the unit to be charged. It can operate on the cord or off it's batteries for cordless use. The trimmer is NOT submersible.<br /><br />The attached guard can be adjusted to 9 length settings with a rotating selector. It can also be taken off for trimming necklines or other areas. There is also a separate smaller attachment that can be used for precision cuts.<br /><br />The vacuum is power and made more powerful over earlier models through the use of the \\"Turbo\\" button that amps up the cutting power and vacuum power substantially. When you are done cutting your hairs are captured in a removable tray for disposal. There are still a few hairs that don't get sucked up but it a huge improvement over using trimmers without suction.<br /><br />The only negatives are that the hair capture cup is a tad small. There is also a plastic piece that guides hair into the cup that makes neck and cheek-line trimming a little tricky until you get the hang of it.<br /><br />Overall a great trimmer for those of us real men with beards. A must have!!
  336. I got this shaver as a surprise for my husband. It seems to work really well for him. I was used pushing down hard to get an even trim with my old one. Well with this new one I pushed so hard that the trimmer length setting was reduced. I didn't realize what was happening until it was all the way down to \\"1\\". I wound up shaving it off. I regrew my facial hair and haven't had any problems since. I just don't push as hard and I make sure it is firmly set on the length I want. BTW: the vacuum feature works great.

  340. I bought this to replace a 4 year old Norelco G390 which served me reasonably well for the past 4 years till its NiCd battery died (bought at a \\"warehouse\\" store for just under $20).<br />There are over 600 reviews with an average of 4 stars and I thought \\"how can 600+ people be wrong?\\" so I bought it.<br /><br />Dumb idea.<br /><br />I won't go through all the pros and not even all the cons so you'll need to read other reviews, I'll just focus on why I simply can't use it and had to return it:<br /><br />1. The distance from the comb interface to the blade - the part that goes up and down and stays at the same distance from the blade - is 1/8 inch longer than on the G390. This is due to the vacuum duct. As a result I was simply not able to get all the way up my mustache to trim it - it simply hit the nose. Other angles of approach or even the lowest trim setting didn't work. I was left with a funny looking longer part of the mustache and looking like a dictator from the previous century which i will not name. I ended up taking the comb attachment off the blade and, using a real comb like hairdressers used to do, trimmer the rest of the way manually. Suffice to say I did not pay $[...] so I could do that.<br />I'll post the image comparing the G390 to this one on Amazon and you can see for yourself how it limit the reach of the blade.<br /><br />2. The vacuum is useless. Sure, it capture a lot of the hair but enough of it drop out too. There is no way I would use it anywhere else but over a sink and even then I'll have to clean both the sink and the little transparent bin - so why pay extra.<br /><br />I've returned it to Amazon the next day.<br /><br />I'm going to look for the G390 or another similar model from Norelco - the G390 was about half price, didn't have vacuum or direct AC but did have multiple attachments, upright stand and lasted 4 years despite the antiquated battery technology.

  346. I was looking to find a groomer that was fast and could provide an even cut on my beard which consists of both straight and curly hair. This one sounded like the right choice plus it had the bonus vacuum feature, but some of the negative reviews about sudden cutting length changes almost made me pass it by. I am happy to say that I purchased the groomer and have had no problems at all with unwanted adjustment changes. With the amount of people complaining about this, I have no doubt that it can happen, but my guess is that in most cases if not all, it has more to do with the way the groomer is being held. I can imagine situations where with a death grip on the adjustment ring and extreme down pressure on the cutting head, one might be able to duplicate the problem during a direction change. I really like the vacuum feature and would put it the 90% range for effectiveness when taking your time and not trying to trim your beard when you're already twenty minutes late! I have normal hearing and do not find the trimmer overly loud even in the turbo mode which for me is the only mode that I use as both the cutting and vacuum features work best at high speed and battery life remains very good.

  350. I purchased this unit to replace a 7-year old Norelco trimmer (that had an integral main blade and an integral mini pop-up blade, but no vacuum).<br /><br />Good Points: Comfortable, not too noisy, even on \\"Turbo\\" setting. Strong blades clip everything in sight. Mini trimmer blade is sharp and precise. Guide pops off easily. Comfortable to hold. Vacuum does pick up lots of beard/stache clippings and it's easy to empty clippings,too. Easy to change lengths. Nice travel bag. Battery life excellent (but do NOT overcharge and obey the drain-to-zero recommendations).<br /><br />Bad Points: Vacuum not strong enough to suck up all clippings...you'll still need to trim over a sink or trash container, which really takes away from the advantage of having the vacuum (even on the Turbo setting). Length indicator needs a stronger click-and-hold ratchet mechanism -- too easy to accidentally change length settings. I miss the pop-up mini trimmer: Having to manually swap out blades is a pain. The trimmer can't stand up, even temporarily...it can only be stored in the bag or lying down.<br /><br />Summary:<br />This trimmer might be the best compromise of cost / features / functionality out there, but was disappointed with the vacuum capabilities even on Turbo. I was very impressed by the cutting quality.

It seems absurd that the only removable part on the unit, a part that is removed regularly as a part of its function, a part that is made of fragile plastic, would not be available for replacement. This means that because I broke two cents worth of plastic, I now have to toss out a $40 beard trimmer.   374. I ordered this to replace a cheap-o Remington razor I bought at Walmart. This razor is great! It adjusts to provide a very close and even trim. The vacuum works extremely well. The charge lasts a very long time. And the carrying case is big enough to carry the razor, the attachments, and the charger with a little room to spare! I only have a few minor complaints: The blades doesn't work well for trimming head-hair. You won't be giving any haircuts with this razor. It also doesn't work well on sideburns. You have to use the mini-trimmer attachment, which works great but is on the small side (making it slightly more difficult to cut a straight line). Also, the vacuum functionality doesn't work quite as well with the mini-trimmer, so there will be some mess. Finally, while the adjuster ring generally performs well, it doesn't \\"click\\" at the right spot in the low number range. I set the ring to '2', but it doesn't usually \\"click\\" until I get to ~2.5. It _does_ lock when it's set to '2', it just doesn't make the \\"click\\" sound to let me know it's locked. This may just be something on the razor I got. While I'm talking about the ring, I will say that I haven't had any issues with the adjuster ring switching to lower numbers mid-shave. If you have this issue, you are either pushing down _way_ too hard, or you have (in my opinion) a defective unit. All-in-all, I'm very pleased with this purchase and I'd recommend it to anyone wanting a good trimmer with less mess.
  375. At first, people think this is some kinda sex-toy from the future. It's not. It's a beard trimmer. And a pretty good one to boot. If you're like me, you use your beard trimmer when you don't have much time in the morning before you have to take off for work. If you trim with this thing quickly on the 'normal' trimming mode, it'll catch maybe 75% of your hair in the vaccuum. However, when you enter warp speed (turbo mode) this thing is insane. It's really loud and sounds like it might explode, but it works great. It catches roughly 90-95% of hair in the vacuum in turbo mode. It's quite easy to take apart to empty out the little hair-catch-all and clean trimmer attachments or swapping them out (comes with a fine-line trimmer). The height adjustment doesn't seem quite as pronounced as my older Norelco trimmer (meaning you can obviously tell when it clicks into place...this one not so much) but it works nonetheless. I'm happy with it and recommend it to all who read this. Just be sure to take a minute out of your abnormally busy day to read the instructions and precautions and maintenance tips to prolong the life of this thing. That's what they're there for, after all.

  385. Bought this to replace my Norelco T-1000 (then found out I could have bought a replacement battery for 10 bucks)which worked just fine until the battery died. The decision to buy was mostly impluse, though I did check Amazon's ratings, but I forgot to read the lowest ratings first! <br /> <br /> I keep a close cut beard or stubble, so I don't need the adjustable settings above maybe # 3 ... <br /> <br />I also don't care about having a vacuum cause I trim over the sink and just rinse it out. Seems like they concentrate on that feature more than the basic design. Not impressed. <br /> <br />The \\"contour\\" spring loaded thing is a joke, I removed it. The charger unit is so bulky and heavy that it will not hang on the wall socket. I have to use an extension cord from the wall and set the \\"brick\\" charger on the counter. <br /> <br />Did not like the feel of the unit right out of the box either, it feels rather cheap (which it is), unlike my old unit. It's fairly large and and bulky, like the charger! <br /> <br />Don't know what the blue plastic floating shield thing is in front of the cutters, but it makes hard to judge depth when trimming without the adjustable guide on. <br /> <br />I'll use it for the time being, then donate it to the thrift store when I find a better unit. Not worried about paying forty bucks, as I can afford to toss away cash at the this moment. Got free shipping too, unlike Ebay sellers that are charging 20 bucks to ship!
  386. I bought the T980 to replace my older model Norelco trimmer, which died after several years of regular use. The vacuum feature really does work pretty well-doesn't pick up every clipped whisker, but I would guess it sucks up about 90%, which ain't bad. The trimmer also has two clipper heads, one for tight trimming, and the other for overall work. One does have to use the \\"Turbo\\" feature all the time, which boosts the suction; the \\"Normal\\" setting doesn't quite do the trick. Overall I'm very happy with this appliance, and heartily recommend it.
  387. The good the bad and the ugly. Here goes. I've always sworn by Norelco trimmers. I've owned several. They normally last reasonably well. I normally get 5 years of use out of them. I say reasonably well because in this day and age, 5 years is good but I prefer things to last 20 years like they used too. Sadly; that's not going to happen. The adjustable guide is the best design that I have found. Far better than similar units that use multiple guides that can get lost, damaged and require additional storage space. The turbo function does work, it has enough high power that calling it &#34;turbo&#34; is not only cool but accurate. The charge/low battery lights function well. The vacuum functions well. I've tried other manufactures so called vacuum units and found that not only did they not work they were a total disappointment. This vacuum system works! Removing and installing the guide was a bit tricky at first but you get used to it. The single thing that I miss is the slide up mini trimmer. Frankly; I would rather have that than the vacuum. Still, I like this product and recommend it! I have had it about a year now and it still works perfect! Update: 3 years old and like new! Update: 5 years old, still like new! If it ever fails I'll be buying another Philips/Norelco.
  388. Bought this to replace an older model Norelco trimmer without a vacuum function. Cuts well, I notice no problem with the height adjustment not staying locked in selected setting as others have mentioned. Vacuum function definately works well. I find it a little bit noisy in turbo mode. My only complaint, and it's not really a complaint, is I did like the simplicity of my older model in just removing the hair comb to use the trimmer head for the detail work. Because of the vacuum attachment you can't do that with this trimmer, you need to remove the comb, and then replace the trimmer head with a smaller trimmer attachment that sticks up past the vaccuum catch. This attachement works well, but it is a little on the small side and I'm still getting used to it. It works fine, but I wish you didn't need to go that extra step of switching out the trimmer blades. If you don't really care about the vacuum function you might want to keep in mind that trade off. Overall, I am very pleased with the purchase, and you can't beat it for under $30 shipped.
  389. I like the beard trimmer, but you have to change the cutting blade to do close trimming. Kind of a pain. I like my older razor where the small cutter popped up from the main unit instead of having to change cutting heads.
  390. Vacuum works great, it works with and without the cord, and it is easy to use. I highly recommend it to anyone! Edit: after several use, I saw that actually this is not a good product at all. First of all, you can easily change the size adjustment during the usage, and you can end up with uneven beard/hair! Second, you have to clean the vacuum chamber really often, once every 10 seconds or so depending on the hair size! If I could, I would remove my 4 stars and put 1 instead! I couldn't use it anymore. I bought Panasonic ER224S All-in-One Cordless Hair and Beard Trimmer (Silver) from Amazon. I am happy, really happy with the Panasonic. Don't buy this Philips Norelco, buy the Panasonic, which is cheaper, easier to handle, more accurate and waterproof!
  391. Ok, here's my summary review of this trimmer. I've had a T900 trimmer for a few years now and wanted to upgrade to a new and hopefully better trimmer. I've had it now for two weeks and here's what I think... * The vacuum is great, period. When shaving with my Norelco T900, the shavings would fly all over the place --- in the sink, behind the faucet, in between the handles of the faucet, and on the floor. With the vacuum set on low, I barely see any clippings now! Now, my wife doesn't get mad any more! * The height adjustment can be easily set, and unlike other reviews mention, I haven't accidentally changed the setting without knowing. * The clipper works great and easily cuts/trims without any effort. This is an upgrade from my T900. * Battery holds its charge pretty well. You can use it with a power cord also when the battery is low. * The smaller trimmer is a now a separate attachment. My T900 has it attached to the trimmer, and it can be popped up or down when needed. To me, this is a downgrade as it is not as convenient. * The parts seem somewhat delicate. I try to be careful as to not cause damage. Overall, the price is good, it works well, and I'm glad I purchased it, and would recommend it to all.
  392. I like this trimmer quite a bit. Feels well-made, big, and so far the battery life has been outstanding. The built-in vacuum may be the weakest part of it, but hey, it's better than no vacuum at all. As long as you go slowly it does a fair job of sucking up the trimmings, so even that complaint is really a very minor one. I haven't experienced any problems with the locking mechanism slipping down to a lower guard setting, and I apply a reasonable amount of pressure. Overall, great product, no regrets.
  393. Not sure how this thing got so many good reviews. The device is completely useless at trimming my beard, and only works on the lowest setting (which is a really close trim). Literally on any setting past the shortest setting, it won't actually trim any hair. Not sure who designed the springy gaurd but its clear just from looking at it that none of the hair actually gets close enough to the blades to get cut. I have an old razor that plugs in and has 3 or 4 different adapters, and that works a lot better. When it does cut, on the really short setting, the vacuum does actually work, but theres a plastic thing that gets in the way and makes it tough to shave with any accuracy. Anyway, hope to prevent people from having the same frustrations I have after spending $40 for something that could barely shave your head much less something a bit more technical, like your face!
  394. I bought this because my wife complained that my beard was too long and shaggy. This did an excellent job trimming and shaping my beard, even to my wife's satisfaction. It was easy to use and easy to clean. Well worth the price.
  395. Pros: It trims very well, nice range of adjustable settings, vacuum feature really does work, good battery and charger. I was in hurry and bought at a local big box store so I overpaid. The Amazon price seems about right for what it is.

  397. Does an excellent job with the trimming itself (I rarely shave, I just occasionally trim with this), and it definitely reduces the amount of hairs left lying all over the sink when I'm done, making cleanup easier, but it is still required. The vacuum does not capture everything, and only makes less of a mess. Don't expect to avoid cleanup entirely with its use.
  398. This trimmer feels great on the face and in the hand. It's sleek and smooth. The vac works great and leaves no mess. Very quite operation. Holds a charge for weeks. Have no need for the turbo mode, works fine in normal mode. Might be needed if removing beard or something. Comes with a small touch up blade that is simple to swap out. Also includes a nice large case that holds everything plus some. This is a major advancement in retail trimmers. Overpriced in stores, not too bad on Amazon.
  399. The trimmer works well in turbo mode for my beard, which I keep fairly short. I'm not sure why there are two speeds; maybe the lower speed is for different whisker types or for longer lengths. I'd definitely recommend starting on a higher length setting and adjusting it shorter until it cuts at the desired length. The first time I used it I set it on \\"2\\" which turned out to be much shorter than I would have liked. I especially like the vacuum feature. Prior to getting this trimmer, there was hair all over the bathroom sink and counter that had to be wiped up after every trim session. My only real complaint is that the unit I received has a flaw in the clear plastic window that covers the \\"length\\" number making it hard to see the number. I would buy it again.
  400. I had a Norelco trimmer that lasted several years and loved it. The main reason I chose the T980 over the T765 is that it can be operated from the plug. However, the comb is difficult to re-attach after cleaning and ultimately busted completely after less than 2 months of use. The vacuum is a nice feature but the receptacle is not secure, sometimes sending hair flying everywhere. The worst part is the vacuum feature makes it impossible to use the bare blade to trim edges; you have to use a separate attachment for this. The button to operate the \\"turbo\\" feature (totally unnecessary) is extremely cheap and came off the first time I pressed it. Norelco / Philips trimmers are definitely the way to go, but don't shell out the extra money for the shoddily designed extra features. Get the T765, I just did as a replacement for this piece of dung.
  401. This T980 is great. It may be a tad louder than normal trimmers but its worth it. Having the built-in vac suck up most of the trimmings makes cleaning up a cinch. And the turbo is a god sent for my coarse beard. The battery life is awesome. I would highly recommend this trimmer to anyone.
  402. This beard trimmer ([[ASIN:B000UCBFKW Norelco T980 turbo vacuum beard and moustache trimmer.]]) is very fine, and I have no complaints at all about it's use. It takes a little learning, but is otherwise great. I bought it through Amazon, in late October 2007.<br /><br />I do have a problem. The catch basket for the vacuum is falling apart when I remove it. Now, that's no big. It's a very light and fragile basket. So I contacted Philips Norelco today to buy a couple of backup replacements.<br /><br />Norelco not only DOESN'T sell any, they WON'T sell any. The best they will do is send an RMA to replace the entire unit. I told them that's just damn nuts, and I don't care if they're willing to do it.<br /><br />So, what I'm asking, has anyone else had this problem? How did you fix it if you did? I'm thinking that it wouldn't take much to glue or otherwise fix the thing. Just wanted to see if anyone else had any ideas.<br /><br />Why don't I just take the new, free unit? Because the idea of replacing an entire damn unit because one little plastic part is just stupidity, and I'm not in the habit of encouraging that. Sure, some bean counter some place decided that if they didn't have an inventory of spare parts, they could save money. Yeah, right.

  405. Integrated mustache trimmer and a more positive lock on the height adjustment would make this a much better product.
  406. In this day and age when almost all portable electronic products are universal power based, I regret to inform you that the Norelco Trimmers are mono voltage and cannot be operated outside the US. The unit can be charged only from (110v /120V). Neither the Philips nor the Amazon websites point this out to buyers. Since I travel outside of the US quite a bit, it is a big hassle to use this trimmer with a voltage converter. I wish Philips would seriously consider this issue and improve on the product, hence two star rating.
  407. This is my 3rd or 4th beard trimmer. I bought this one because I wanted one that also worked when it was plugged in (I don't have where to leave it plugged in). That works well but I am really impressed with the vacuum feature. It really works as advertised. Very little cleanup required afterwards - makes for a happy spouse.
  408. My husband likes this trimmer much better than the older model he had. The vacuum isn't perfect, so some of the trimmings still get in and around the sink. He loves that it has a battery indicator so he knows when it needs to be charged. The old one stayed plugged up all the time because he didn't want it it be dead when he needed to use it. This one is much better because it has a light that comes on when the battery is low. So far, he hasn't had to charge it much.
  409. Look and feel is very stylish and the blade technology is pretty impressive. Only thing I feel is that the construction is not as solid as it appears specially when you hold it.   411. Delivery was fast in a good condition. The item we were expecting. My husband enjoy using it
  412. Only tried it once so far -- for beard trimming -- but it's very promising. The \\"mowing\\" operation -- getting my beard to an even length -- went extremely well. It was easy, the results were good, and the vacuum did a surprisingly good job of capturing most of the trimmed hair. The \\"edging\\" operation was a little less successful, but I think that new personal care products like this always take a little while to get used to. I'm optimistic that I'll go from liking it to loving it with a little practice. And the battery ran the trimmer strongly throughout that first session. It's a Ni-Cad battery, so you KNOW it will disappoint you in the end, but: - The instructions are very clear about how to maximize a Ni-Cad battery's life. - You can always fall back to corded operation. (That's a smart design.)
  413. I've had this trimmer for about 1 year now. It doesn't get a lot of use, I only trim about every 1.5-2 weeks (yes, I'm a bit lazy like that). So at most, I've used the trimmer about 35 times. It should work longer and better than that.<br /><br />A few uses ago I went to pull out the little plastic trimmings compartment and the front of the compartment pulled off, leaving the rest inside the unit. It appears that these pieces are just glued together.<br /><br />The second strike is that it doesn't catch about 20% of the trimmed hair, even in Turbo mode. I've tried it trimming very short amounts of hair, or longer. It doesn't seem to matter much.<br /><br />The third strike is that 2-3 times during a trimming I have to remove the trimming guide, and then the blades to remove hair from underneath the blades. I don't see why hair should get trapped under there, but it does and reduces the trimming ability significantly. I don't think I should have to dismantle the trimmer to trim my beard. It's done this since day one.<br /><br />Otherwise, it works pretty well. With some patience and a bit of mess it does a pretty good job at trimming. This is my third Norelco trimmer, none of them seem to have much staying power, my other two had similar clogging issues with the blade, and both had the rechargeable battery die.
  414. This product is awesome. It works really well and priced right. The battery holds a charge for a long time between uses. The height adjusts easily. My only concern is the strength of the door. I think it might break off after several uses.
  415. I am a firm believer in facial hair, but often try to avoid that shaggy look. The cat mistakes my face and starts nuzzling a little too enthusiastically. I have trimmed with scissors, rasors, the old cip on guard trimmers and the grandfather of this trimmer which just recently died after 7 years of service (not bad Norelco!). Like its grandfather, the click adjustable guard is the single best reason to buy one of these trimmers. It does struggle a little bit with longer bushy hairs (as most do), but works like a champ when keeping previously trimmed ones in check. Clean up is fairly easy, plus this one looks really cool. The only thing I am not inlove with is, and that it has a super rechargeable battery which will have to be removed one day and recycled appropriately. Replacement batteries and recycling can be a challenge, and I'd almost rather just have a corded mode. Otherwise I totally love it. The vacuum and turbo vacuum featured on this model are an interesting new rendition, and they do a fair job capturing most (not all) of the shavings. Admittedly though I have only used the turbo vacuum on my person as I cant imagine a situation when you'd want less suckage... except to make this more stealthy when you have a few beers and decide its time to shave the cat... having done so, the cat is now afeard of both the trimmer and any other vacuum noises. Even a long drag though a straw now makes Mitsy Boots nervous. My sink drain and my wife are quite grateful with the vacuum, the cat not so much.
  416. I have owned various panasonic beard trimmers for past 20 years, untli the non-replaceable batteries go bad. This is the first one I have had which sucks the trimmings into a built-in container, which is a great idea. The problem is it clogs every 2-3 strokes, which makes it unusable. Now, if you use this on a daily or every 2-3 day basis, and are cutting hairs taht are 1/8\\" long, for instance, I bet it would work well. But when you do trimming every 1-2 weeks, and the hair is 1/4\\" or longer for head hair, it will clog, and this product is not for you. So I would give it 0 stars if you are like me, or 4 stars if you plan on using it constantly, for an overall score of 2 stars.
  417. Such a wonderful product. I've had numerous trimmers over the years and this beats them all by miles.

After you've used it about 3 or 4 times, you'll really understand how to use it and love it. I cannot say enough about it. The only thing I can say negative about it is the it is hard to reach that little moustache area directly under the nostrils, but that is usually the case for trimmers and razor blades.
  419. I have had the Norelco for over a month and use it regularly. I have not had some of the negative experiences others have had. It did not magically switch levels causing my beard to be cut unevenly. That was a real concern I had was that it would be so loose that it would not keep the proper height adjustment but I have not had a slip, a inadvertent level change, nor have I had a problem with the buttons switching from turbo to regular speed. I have read one should not \\"push too hard.\\" I have not had to \\"push\\" at all. I read and followed the instructions and it has performed excellently. It has functioned very well. It is easy to clean and the vacuum actually works well. There is very little mess to clean up. I am sure every product purchased will have some kind of \\"negative,\\" but I have not experienced any that were listed in the 1-2 star reviews. I liked it so much, that I bought the Norelco Arcitec electric razor. That is how much it impressed me! It is a trustworthy, reliable product that performs much better than the Remington and Wahl I previously owned. It even has done a remarkable job maintaining its charge. I am impressed with the Norelco products, their performance, and value. As with all products, I would recommend that you read the instructions on proper use and not just pull out of the box and wonder what is wrong or why it does not perform like your old trimmer.
  420. There are plenty of reviews on this trimmer so I won't go into detail - but I did want to make sure I rated the item. I think overall the trimmer is a good product - it does what it is supposed to do. After a few months of use (1-2 times a week), I developed my own pro's con's for the trimmer. It replaced a very cheap Remington trimmer that I had for years (the rechargable battery no longer held a charge) and although I know \\"change\\" can be tough after using something for several years, there are a few things I just can't get past.<br /><br />1. having to remove the general trimmer and replace it with the mini trimmer is more of a PITA than I thought it would be. My old Remington had a built in mini-trimmer that flipped up on the back side - nothing to remove - just flip up and use. On the Philips, pulling the gate off and swapping the basic trimmer for the mini trimmer is pretty annoying. Granted it's not that big of a deal in the grand scheme of life or my morning routine, but it is still pretty annoying. When you remove the gate and start swapping parts, some of the hair that did make its way into the vacuum chamber now gets scattered about again.<br /><br />2. many have complained about the height adjustment changing on them... I have not encountered this. I can add that for me, none of the settings match my old Remington. This is not so much a reflection on the product, but more of a: \\"keep in mind, you'll have to adjust to this new product's height - it doesn't adjust to you\\". I keep my hair short and for me 3 is too long and 2 is too short. I needed a 2.5. I find that if I press really hard in the 3 setting, I can get close, but it seems to take a lot of work. Again, not so much a complaint on the product, just personal preference.<br /><br />3. For whatever reason, I can not seem to get the hairs on my lip that are close to the underside of my nose. The trimmer gate seems to be so bulky that it hits my nose before the cutter can clip the hair. I have to remove the gate and carefully trim the hairs using the height of the surrounding hairs that the trimmer did get as a guide.<br /><br />Other than those three annoyances, I can live with the vacuum not catching ALL of the hair (the Remington flung ALL of the hair everywhere). Battery life seems solid, but I guess only time will tell. Someone else mentioned they wished it came with a stand and I concur - it would be nice. Overall it's a solid product and for those with a lot of facial hair, I bet this would be a great purchase.te and carefully trim the hairs using the height of the surrounding hairs that the trimmer did get as a guide. Other than those three annoyances, I can live with the vacuum not catching ALL of the hair (the Remington flung ALL of the hair everywhere). Battery life seems solid, but I guess only time will tell.   428. Good product - vacuum (no stray bits of hair), self-sharpinging, holds a long charge, works in close quarters, very competative price
  429. If you're like me, you start out reading the 1 star reviews to find out what's wrong with a product. You will see a lot of alarmist reviews claiming the trimmer shifts length settings without the person knowing. This does happen, but if and only if you have not set the razor attachment on correctly. The razor comes with a beard trimmer and a mustache trimmer, which involves switching attachments. Not setting the attachment on correctly will cause problems. However, if you set it up correctly (not difficult), then no problem occurs. I like this razor because it has a long lasting battery, which makes the whole process much easier. It cleans easily, and captures a good amount of hair to prevent a giant sink mess. It cuts well, and accurately, although it does take me a while because you have to keep going over the beard to make sure all the hairs are cut to the same length. The mustache trimmer is a great addition as well, because it allows for some precision. So assuming you can figure out how to work this product correctly, it should do exactly what you need it to!
  430. This trimmer has a dial-like setting for determining the length of hair. Unfortunately the razor has a VERY bad spring/strength mechanism for holding the desired length in place; i.e.: I like to shave at a \\"3\\" and by the mere act of pressing the razor against my face [HEAVAN FORBID!!], it pushes the guide down to level \\"2\\" & \\"1\\" which are closer to the blades and lead to considerably shorter hair. I thought this was simply a manufacturing fluke when I first bought it, so I returned the trimmer directly to Norelco (very friendly service). The replacement they sent was 'stiffer' for a couple of months, but now it's back to the same ol' defect - I'm left with a beard that looks like I just haven't shaved for a week.
  431. I purchased this product because blades are too expensive these days and I'm just not a morning person. I like the stubble look so after searching product reviews, purchasers of the 980 seemed confident in it's ability to take care of business on setting #1. It does a great job, 90% of hair gets sucked into the trap. No facial irritation. The only thing you may need is a regular razor to shape your beard's edges. With the length guard removed you can get pretty close but if you want no hair there you'll need to resort to trimming to zero length then shaping with a razor (while not perfect in that it can't do it all, the results are perfect)! Pros: Light reasonably quiet no oiling! grip it by the twist height adjuster and it works great Cons: doesn't have a foil-like shaver attachment for removing hair to zero no stand/dock (only a neg for people who have no place to hide it) not a smart charger I believe it's an old style battery so don't expect it to last as long as lithium
  432. Purhased the shaver about 1 month ago. Owned a previous model that worked OK but had limitations that, for the most part have been resolved in this model. I have a gote and need to trim my mustache from my upper lip regularly. Pros: Long battery life. I've had the unit for about a month and not had to recharge it yet. Trimmer attachment is easy to install so I no longer have to bring 2 separate trimmers with me when I travel for business. It looks cool. Not that looks of the shaver are important but it doesn't hurt. Ergonomics. Easy to hold and use. Buttons placed in easy to use positions. Turbo adjustment. Haven't had the need yet but it wil;l come in handy I guess for longer hair trimming. Vacuum to suck up clippings. What can I say. Excellent. Not a gimmick. Cons: I wish they offerred a nose hair trimming attachment as well. It is a slight drag to change heads. I wish they had a slide button to push up the thinner blade and would have sacrificed the vacuum for the thinner trimmer as it is used (in my case) for trimming hair that isn't long to begin with. The hair collection compartment is OK. I clean if after every use but my old one had a cup that removed so I could empty it and this one has a door that opens so you have to hold the unit over the garbage can to empty and it is a drag as I blow out remaining hair instead of using the supplied brush so there is a greater chance the clippings will get on the floor as it is hard to blow it out and aim the refuse. Months later now and it is still working very wello. Does a great job!
  433. Best price. Seven day free shipping. Easy to use. Trims Mustache evenly at lowest setting. Great for tumble look or long Mustache.
  434. I purchased this trimmer nearly 6 years ago and it has served me well. I put it to use nearly every day of ownership.
  435. Works better than expected and better than the less expense models. The turbo feature helps speed up morning trims, and the vacuum makes the sink area less messy. I like its adjustable beard-length feature...no need to keep switching clip-on heads. I'd buy it again.
  436. At first I thought that this thing just doesn't cut hair well. I have a very thick beard. But once I figured out how to position the thing and use it correctly, I found it to be just fine. Very much worth the price. It cuts hair well, most all of the hair gets sucked in by the vacuum feature (some hair ends up in the sink, but not much.) It's comfortable and convenient ... the best I've been able to find these days.
  437. Best. Trimmer. Ever. Nothing is perfect, but this gives us an idea of the perfect trimmer. Have at it!
  438. After looking high and low and doing much research I am very happy with this trimmer. The vacuum works much better than expected and the trimmer works without any pulling or biting like other trimmers. The only suggestion that I would make to the manufacturer is: I would like a 1.5 setting rather than 7-9. I bought this trimmer after some shaver shop owners I spoke too told me that this was the best. None of them had the vacuum feature, but owned the identical non vacuum model themselves. Don't be disappointed, buy the best.
  439. Better than expected. Vacuum keeps all the hair in the trimmer until you unload it. Beats the mess that I used to make all over the counter. Variable trim lengths work well. Charge lasts a long time.

I practically shaved off my goatee after it switched from the 3 to the 1 setting by itself. The vacuum doesn't work all that well and if you travel, it is so easy to accidentaly turn this on as it just takes the slightest pressure on the switch to start it up. Bad news all around.
  441. It seems fine for a battery operated trimmer, EXCEPT! The trimmer doesn't stay at the setting you want. So, I used it for the first time this AM, put the setting on 5 or 6, but after a few strokes on the beard, it reset itself to the lowest setting. So, one spot on my beard is now down to a stubble. So, I have to go ahead and shave the rest of my beard that short. I tested it over and over, and slight pressure resets the length mechanism. <br /> <br />Long and short, the thing doesn't work.   444. If you set it on level 5 and you push too hard, you may not have a beard. The locking system is a joke. The Norelco trimmer I bought 7 years ago has a better locking system.
  445. As some other reviews I read have stated, this trimmer does not trap all the hair with its vacuum. However, cleanup is much much easier than it would be without any vacuum so I think its worth the extra money for the vacuum. <br />Overall I think the trimmer does a good job trimming evenly and the attachment for detailed trimming is excellent.
  446. I have had this trimmer for about a month now. It is easily the best beard trimmer of the many that I have owned. Exceptionally well thought out, simple design is very user friendly. The vacuum feature, which I was actually pretty skeptical about, works extremely well: there are only a few clippings that fall to the sink or countertop requiring cleanup after trimming. Cleaning of the trimmer itself is a snap as well. The depth gauge, blade head and vacuum collection chamber all simply pull off and on smoothly without any difficulty lining them up or anything like that. I also really like the feature of running off either corded or cordless. I can use the battery to complete depletion and then finish the trim using the cord. This will allow me to fully discharge the battery and, hopefully, give it a longer life. I haven't actually had the battery run down yet -- even I use it 2-3 times per week -- so I'm liking battery life as well.
  447. I was happily surprised that the vacuum feature actual does work. Normally when i trim my beard the bathroom counter is covered in hair which is annoying to clean, but with this buzzer about 85% of the hair gets contained in the buzzer and is easily emptied. Also the range of buzzing lengths is very good. Over all so far i really like the buzzer.
  448. Update: Using the Turbo mode helps substantially in vacuuming up beard hairs. However, it still doesn't get them all, so you still have to do some cleanup. I'm not changing my rating; just adding this info. It works well enough. Original ------------------- I've only had the Turbo Vacuum Trimmer for a few weeks, but my experience so far has been mostly positive. It trims well and is fairly easy to use. However, I'm also not really seeing much benefit from the vacuum part. I don't use the turbo mode and it still leaves numerous beard hairs which I have to clean up afterwards. Also, due to the added bulk of the vacuum, it's a little less precise than my old Norelco trimmer, which it replaced. If I had my choice, at this point, I would have preferred to stick with the old one (it was worn out).
  449. I purchased this trimmer recently for my husband to trim his beard. He said it is a handy little trimmer and works well, but it is rather noisy at regular speed and sounds like a small jet engine in his ear with the turbo on! When he uses it in the bathroom I can hear it through the closed door. Also I have noticed that despite the jet engine sucking noises there is a fair amount of very small pieces of beard that still escape and wind up on the sink. I was hopping that I would not have to clean these up after a beard trimming session any more! Definitely less clean up, but still have to clean the sink, and surrounding counter. It does do a good job keeping his beard at an even length and is much easier to use and consistent that the comb an scissors routine that he was trying before we got the norelco. The little accessory neck trimmer works great for touch ups between haircuts, but the vacume does not work at all with that attachement in place. All in all a decent trimmer but could be quieter and it would be nice if the vacume was more effetive and worked with the neck trimmer.
  450. The electric beard razor works as promised. It's fast and easy. It is easy to adjust, relatively quite, vacumms up the cuttings quite well. The only thing that could be improved would to have a built in edge trimmer. Changing the blade to trim is easy but when you are used to a flip out edge trimmer on your regular razor you don't see why this could have the same feature. Next time.
  451. The first 3-4 times I used this trimmer I had somehow shaved a bald spot in my beard. I would have to shave my beard off and start over next week then. Not to be put off I set forth to master this trimmer. I found that with practice it gets better. I still find that it doesn't really do the best job at making my beard look consistent. On the shortest setting I will get some hairs which are like 1/8\\" long while others are closer to 3/8\\" long. I am not sure if it's my technique or what, but I have just found it best to avoid using the #1 setting for the shortest hair. This is not the beard trimmer to use if you are wanting to maintain the rough look. That is ultimately what I am trying to do, and I am having an issue with it. On the other hand, its amazing at any other length, which is why I was still able to give it 4 stars.
  452. when I ordered it I knew the vacuum wasn't going to catch all the hair. To my surprise it almost did.   454. definitely better made and better performing than previous Norelcos. the shaver's really loud. vacuum is about 90% effective. turbo may or may not speed things up, but it's definitely way louder. still has a tendency to go down a trimmer level while you shave if you're not careful and put too much pressure on it.
  455. This is a good product overall but I found two flaws, that seem to concur with other reviewers complaints. I like to trim my face close, on the 2/3 setting. 1)The length-dial clicks out of place while you are trimming. This happens at least once during each shave, usually when shaving the left side of my face (I am right handed). So if you are on the 2 setting and you apply pressure on the face, it jumps down to 1. I have been holding the dial with my index finger. Kind of annoying. Also there is significant play (wiggle room) in the dial itself. Odd, and annoying. 2) It is nearly impossible to get the area under the nose/above the lip with the guard on, its just too bulky...Overall, good power, never pulls hairs, sharp blades, and the vaccum does its job for the most part.
  456. I have been using the T980 for over 3 months now, and I'm very pleased with it. It gives a superior, even beard and mustache trim, glides smoothly across without snagging, and catches most (yes, not ALL) your clippings. As others warn, it can trim pretty close if you set the dial too low, I found out the hard way with a \\"2\\" and eventually settled on \\"4\\" for my setting. I am not a fan of the trimmer when you take the guard off, I still prefer my old Norelco for this, and I do wish it had a nose/ear trimmer also, but these are minor gripes.   457. so far so good. product works very well, gets close with a very even cut. very easy cleaning, great product!
  458. I had an old norelco that lasted 10 years, but the internal battery only lasted about 3 minutes before i finally threw it out...this trimmer is a huge step up with cutting and the vaccum. there is NO way for the guard to drop to a lower setting unless you turn the setting dial--i guess all the negative reviews where the setting dropped while in use were on a different model? works great and i am glad that i bought it...i am really picky and read all the reviews and was a bit skeptical...so im writing now to tell you that for under 40 bucks, you cant go wrong. This thing should last me a long time (it comes with a 2 year warranty) and will pay for itself becuase it allows me to keep the beard/goatee at my corporate job and fight the man!
  459. This is my first beard trimmer for use with my first beard. I read many of the other reviews of the Norelco T980 and having a Norelco electric razor decided to give it a try. I've been generally impressed, although I've never owned another trimmer to compare the T980 to. Some of the concerns that others noted (followed by my own impressions): Loudness: Yes, trimming with a mini-vacuum is a little louder than without. In particular, when 'Turbo' mode is on, it sounds like a mini-buzz-saw. That said, unless you're worried about waking a sleeping baby in the same room, it's not obnoxiously loud. Vacuum doesn't catch clippings: Even though this is my first beard, I know trimmings tend to go everywhere when trimming a beard. I didn't expect the vacuum to catch everything (especially since I'm using the trimmer to leave my beard at a 1/2\\" length- setting 7 of 9). I always use 'Turbo' mode (hoping that more suction will catch more of the clippings), and I tend to catch ~75% of the clippings this way. The biggest issue is that the clippings it doesn't catch tend to be the ones that go sailing across the room (for my wife to find later)-but I would assume any trimmer would do that with my facial hair. Needs frequent charging: As I said above, I always use the trimmer in 'Turbo' mode and it's not supposed to last very long that way. However, I've been using three times a week for the last month and have charged it twice. Charging once every couple of weeks was within my expectations. Smaller trimmer involves removing regular trim head: People who complained about having to change trim heads must be in a much more significant hurry than I am in the morning. The height guide and standard trim head slip off easily (5 seconds or less-literally). The precision trim head slips on just as easily and really does a nice job with touch-up areas. The precision trim head extends away from the body of the trimmer more than the standard one, making it easier to clean up errant hair. Height guide slips when trimming: I haven't seen this problem at all. I was very concerned about it (I didn't want to accidentally shave off the beard I spent all this time growing), but really, any concern of this at all can be eliminated by holding the trimmer so that your grip doesn't allow the height guide to move (which, at least for me, is a perfectly normal way to hold the trimmer). The storage pouch is a little weird, but I found I can fit both the trimmer and my electric razor in it without any problems, so all the better. Bottom line- the T980 is generally a good little trimmer.
  460. The thing I like the best is the vacuum option. My sink is a lot cleaner now. Works well and doesn't snag hairs. Not sure who would need the \\"turbo\\" option. I think you could harvest crops with that speed.
  461. the trimmer is really good and very handy. main thing I like with this trimmer is that its not bulky and easily fits into my shaving kit. besides the one charge does last really long.

  469. Having worn a beard for appx. 30 years, I've used a lot of trimmers, at a lot of settings. Love the length settings--for the first time, I have a length setting that doesn't fall between the length I desire. Also, you can't beat the hair catcher. Makes sink clean-up a cinch. Haven't found a use for the turbo setting yet, but I press it occasionally just to hear it rev and be reassured that all the features truly do work <grin>. Would recommend for anyone who wears a beard or goatee.

  473. Sure the Trimmer has 9 different settings, but what they don't tell you is that you'll usually end up with a 2 every time unless you tape it down. What I mean is, when you're trimming with it, and press to hard, the settings will actually change. So even though I wanted a 5, I pressed too hard and ended up with a 4 and I was stuck with a 4 in a spot surrounded by 5. From a 4 I was like shoot, now I gotta shave it all to make it even. Then when you're shaving to make it all an even 4, you accidently press too hard on one spot. OOPS! Now I have three...and the cycle continues. Other than that, no complaints really--just the vacuum doesn't pick up all the hairs.

  484. This is my second beard trimmer. Previously had a [...] that was powered by 3 AAA batteries. Was very underpowered and I stopped using it. The Norelco trimmer works much better.   485. My T980 does almost everything perfectly: it holds a charge for weeks; its vacuum reduces the number of trimmed hairs around the sink by about 70%; it feels wonderful and it works quickly. However, my T980 does NOT stay at the level I set it at. If I don't firmly grip the length setting wheel it will jump from, say, a 5 to a 3 -- as it did this morning -- embarrassing me either by giving me a patchy trim or by forcing me to shorten my beard length. This problem doesn't seem to be a result of the way I'm, say, holding the trimmer -- I used the [[ASIN:B0001HYL0M T765]] for four years without having this problem -- but rather a flaw in the trimmer itself. From these reviews, it seems like only a few of the T980s have this problem; still, you might want to try the [[ASIN:B000FED5D0 T780]], which doesn't seem to have this problem -- I wish I had. Update 3/12/08: Make me look like a fool once, shame on me; make me look like a fool twice, shame on you. I've used this trimmer about 12 times since writing this review, and by a combination of duct tape, a pinch grip, and a good deal of vigilance I had been able to avoid too many embarrassing shifts in beard length. ...until this morning, when it shifted silently from a 5 (Late Winter Academic Beard) to 3 (Peach Fuzz) in mid-shave. Two options: shave my entire beard to a 3, which is inappropriate for my face type, or look deranged because half of my face is at 5 and half is at 3. I threw my T980 in the garbage ten minutes ago.

  492. This T980 trimmer does everything nicely, but not as nicely as the discontinued and no longer available Philips Norelco T-3000. There are more beard length settings on this one, but you can't easily see them like you could on the T-3000, and more settings are not really needed. This one has a micro-trimmer which has to be installed, instead of the pop-up capability on the T-3000. This one has a turbo speed which the T-3000 didn't have and which I don't need and have never used. In short, the company has replaced an excellent product with one that is only good.
  493. I've been using my T980 for two years. I appreciate that it minimizes cleanup. I've found my length setting (3) and trim my beard about every 4-5 days. I travel with this all the time.   494. This purchase was to replace a Wahl trimmer that died suddenly after a couple of years. It had done a good job but the feature I liked best about it was the built in vacuum. Stopped my wife from complaining about a trail of hair on the sink. After a quick look thru the internet I soon discovered this vacuum feature was a rarity. Then I found the NorelcoT980 Turbo here on Amazon. It has the vacuum and a extra Turbo function that your first time you'll think it's going to pull off all the hair. Well it doesn't but the motor does get louder in turbo and I'm sure it also eats up more battery power. It's a well made piece of machinery that feels good in your hand. The heigh adjustment click in nicely. The cover over the blades ride nicely over your face but this is something you'll have to use the included cleaning brush to wipe out hair that will stick in it's nicks and crannies. There is a second blade that is used for finer detailing like around your mouth. It works well and enables you to keep the hair out of your mouth. Funny thing about the attachments. The first few times you change them or remove the hair catcher they seem to be difficult to remove. But soon they pop off easily. Suppose it's just a matter of learning were to pull. I do wish it came with a stand for the razor. It comes with a pouch that you can store a everything including the charger, but somehow I get the feeling Norelco though us guys with beards travel a lot. I don't and would have like a place to sit the T980 where I can grab it for a quick trim.

  496. THIS THING IS AWESOME. I AM NEVER SHAVING AGAIN. I just used it for the first time and have decided that I will never use a razor again. I am a guy who never likes to shave, I maintain the \\"few days of stubble\\" look throughout the week, and dread the day when I have to go through the hassle of lathering up & shaving. But this thing is so easy to use and it just cuts you down to whatever stubble-level you want in like 2 minutes!!!!
