  497. I have been using the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer for a couple of months. It is the best trimmer I have used. It trims fast and evenly. There has been zero pulling or pinching. The vacuum is helpful, retaining up to 90% of the trimmed hair. It works better than I anticipated. I have not tried the Turbo mode since the regular setting works perfectly so far. I have not experienced any issues with the beard length setting changing while in use that others have remarked on. Time will tell if parts fatigue plus pressing hard against the face will cause this in the coming months. I do agree with others about the initial awkwardness of trimming with the comb-like top guide part off. There is a retractable shield in front of the blade that is designed to facillitate trimmed hair going down into the curved waste basket of the vacuum instead of falling in the sink. It would be nice if you could manually lock this shield down when doing fine edge trim. You will get used to it quickly, but the design makes fine trimming more of a blind operation, i.e. you do it by feel more than sight since the shield blocks my view. I use a little more care when fine trimming than with my older model, but the extra seconds aren't too much hassle and the results are fantastic. The trimmer is of good size but handles easily and with better precision than I initially thought. I'm still on my first charge with about 10 trims and still running strong - no recharge indicator light yet. There is a little brush for cleaning the trimmer that works OK. Philips Norelco recommends cleaning after every trim. Cleaning is a drag but should keep the unit working better longer. Only thing missing is a recharger/storage stand. You get a travel bag instead. Bottom line, excellent trimmer. Would recommend to all.
  498. I bought this unit, a little concerned about some of the reviewers who said the length adjustment changed too easily. I found that not to be an issue at all. Even with substantial pressure on the comb assembly, the length setting does not accidentally change. The vacuum system probably catches 85% of the clippings with the turbo vacuum on. Which when cleaning up the sink so as to not put a hair-ball down the drain, it is a very nice assist. The batteries last nicely even with the turbo vacuum on, certainly lasts longer than it takes for me to trim my beard. Like the performance, handling and the results of this beard trimmer.
  499. Let's see... to begin with, it works. The blades work, the vacuum works, the height adjustment works. Everything works and works well. It came with a detail trimmer attachment that is really nice and a little storage case for everything. I normally don't give out 5-star ratings for things, but I just can't find anything to complain about and it exceeded my expectations on every function. I think the only way they could possibly improve it would be to make it waterproof so I could use it in the shower. Please?!?!
  500. I bought this for my husband for two reasons: 1) because he hates how a clean shave looks, and how it irritates his skin, and 2) because I hate cleaning up all those tiny hairs from the bathroom sink. This shaver is pretty awesome, as it hasn't irritated his skin at all, and he really likes that it leaves a nice stubble-y look and it lets him precision trim his beard/goatee. Plus, the vacuum works decently, and gets most (not quite all, but most) of the little hairs so I don't have a dirty, clogged sink. Overall, I'm very pleased with this purchase. The shaver does everything it promises, and the price is great, too.
  501. I think this thing is great. I used to have a Braun one that was similar until it broke because of the hinge to change from beard to mustache trimming. This has interchangeable heads so that wont be an issue. The turbo is a little louder than regular, but I don't think its that bad. I don't shave everyday, so when I do there is a lot of hair. The reservoir that the vacuum goes to is a bit small but as people have said, even if it doesn't get all the hair, it still makes the cleanup easier. Highly reccomended.
  502. I ordered this trimmer online and in less then a week I had the product delivered. I wanted to use it a little before posting a review. The trimmer is awesome and I am glad I purchased it. Definitely will keep the seller in mind for the future. Very satisfied with my choice.
  503. This is the best beard trimmer I've ever owned. I love the vacuum feature which makes clean up a breeze. No more trying to clean up those little hairs. I also like the nine cutting positions. It makes it easier to groom your beard to exactly the right length.
  504. I bought the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer because the older version I had died after about 3 years of use. Overall, I enjoy using this trimmer. The adjustments stay in place and do not \\"jump\\" while in use. The vacuum doesn't get every little stray hair but I would say 95% are caught when I use the turbo function. The vacuum power of this model is much better than other brands I have tried.
  505. Before this product, I used the T860; so my review is basically a comparison of the two experiences.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- The T980 vacuum feature is very nice. Not perfect, but catches most whiskers. Easy to pop off, dump in trash, and pop back on.<br />- T980 Trim settings are almost exact to the T860's<br /><br />Cons<br />- The T980 \\"Clipper Guide Comb\\" is made of a thicker plastic than the T860. Maneuverability right under the nose is difficult resulting in longer whiskers near my nostrils. The T860 got in close under the same trim settings.<br />- I've found no use for the \\"Turbo\\" function<br />- When I take the \\"Clipper Guide Comb\\" off for manual cleaning, it is difficult to put it back on.
  506. Absolutely no pinching or pulling, just smooth and efficient. It's larger than the Wahl or the Remington I had before, but works many times more effectively than either. The vacuum feature is great, and it is easy to clean. The adjustable comb tilts easily, and the whole head can be removed and replaced without any effort at all. This is probably the perfect trimmer.
  507. This thing is truly awesome... If you are more intelligent than a trained monkey you will have no problem using this trimmer for virtually any place you can grow hair... Works on beard and mustache great, cuts head hair, arm pits and trims other body hair places wonderfully! Works at full capacity even while plugged in and charging. Motor has 2 speeds. The vacuum function works really well, hardly any stray clippings on the sink. The hair collector cup snaps in and out with ease and rinses clean. I can't say much more raving about this without getting repetitive. My wife told me that I rave about how much I love it every time I use it that I should right a comment about it. So enough said... Buy it, it's absolutely wonderful for the price, especially when paired with the nose/ear/brow trimmer that I bought in the package.
  508. I have a fairly thick beard. This trimmer delivers as advertised. It is powerful, holds a great charge and the vacuum feature works as designed. The vacuum keeps me from cleaning the sink of hair so it doesn't go down the drain. I have tried several trimmers over the last ten years - Wahl, Panasonic, an older Norelco - this is the best by far. Great value. I highly recommend it.
  509. I got this a while back, I think two years ago. It started dying about a year ago. I think the vacuum just sucked the life out of the battery. It did well for me. Just wished it would last longer. The vacuum on this worked fairly well. You have to make sure you clean it often or it will clog up the vacuum and your beards will fall all over the place.
  510. It's certainly not all that. I've had it a year and a half and the whisker tray already broke. If you empty it every day, it falls apart. If you don't empty it each day, whiskers end up all over the place, including inside the floppy, soft case that has trouble keeping its contents inside. Despite the vacuum action, whiskers collect in every nook and cranny. If you like your grooming aids sanitary, you'll have fun cleaning this thing (and, except the adjustable guide and whisker tray, you can't wash it in water)! Speaking of the adjustable guide, check the setting often, or you'll end up with a surprise...a much closer cut than you expected. The spring-loaded dial adjuster with \\"digital\\" read-out doesn't hold its settings as you press harder to get an even cut...it gets worse the more you use it. This is my second Norelco trimmer and the previous one did the same. Conclusion: I wanted Braun-quality to match their stellar shavers (I'm on my third Braun shaver in twenty years of use), but they discontinued their beard trimmer. While the Norelco is certainly not in the same universe as Braun in quality, neither are they in price. The best thing I can say about this trimmer is that at least it's cheap to buy...a plastic throw-away you have to re-buy every year or two. UPDATE: I called Norelco before the 2-year warrantee elapsed. Since the whisker tray broke in two pieces and the spring-loaded beard guide is on it's last leg (thin plastic holds in the \\"springs\\" and is very fragile), Norelco decided to replace the unit en toto. They said they'd send a new one out and that I should just put the old one back in the same box, apply the PP label they'll include and drop the whole enchilada in the mail. It's nearly two weeks, and I still haven't seen hide nor hair of the new shaver. Only time will tell if Norelco stands behind their product (and their promises). UPDATE (3/11/09): Well, the replacement unit finally came, after three weeks and four phone callls. Apparently, the thing was on backorder, but nobody at Phillips/Norelco Customer Service bothered to disclose that fact, nor did they provide a tracking number. After my fourth call yesterday, they finally provided me a UPS tracking number which was moot as the package arrived when I returned home from work. So far, so good..at least it works and isn't falling apart. Unfortunately, I have no faith that this one will perform and hold-up any better than the first. At least I won't have to buy another until this one breaks. Update (7/22/09): Well, only four months after receiving the new replacement trimmer, the whisker tray (aka \\"hair collection chamber\\") has fallen apart, just like it did on my original defective trimmer. The difference this time is that Norelco is hanging me out to dry and is refusing to do anything to repair/replace this poorly designed and manufactured product. They claim that because the warantee period is up on the ORIGINAL defective unit, that they can do nothing about the replacement unit they supplied, i.e., they won't stand behind the product even though any other new one has a TWO-Year warrantee. FYI, the original unit was bought from Amazon on 4/7/07. As such, I am downgrading the original 3-star rating to ONE-STAR and changing my review title from \\"It's Just OK\\" to reflect my true feelings about this product. As such, I will NEVER buy another Phillips-Norelco product again!
  511. I've been trimming a short beard (1/4\\") for 30 years and used several methods. Also used an earlier version of this trimmer for 3 years. -It's a great trimmer, overall I'm satified with it. Easily adjustable. I can trim beard and mustache in under 5 minutes, including ALL hairs off the sink (that's for my lovely wife). -Particular Pro - I've had 4 of these cordless trimmers and have always replaced them because rechargeable batteries go bad. Costs as much to replace the pack as a new trimmer. This is the first where you can trim while charging. Hopefully, there will be no missed trims because the bats are dead. -Pro - Vacuum is significantly better than on their last version. Not perfect but better. Also the airway that carries the hairs to the storage chamber is wider and doesn't clog. This was a problem on earlier version. Don't know how well vacuum would work on longer hairs. -Con - This one has a door with a hinge to empty the hairs. Earlier version had removable cup which seemed much easier to use. Looks like a step backwards to me but maybe I'll get used to it.
  512. My fiance bought this for me at Christmas and it has been a perfect gift. The basic product itself is sturdy but I travel for work so in the course of my travel I broke the outer guard on the blade, but for the majority of my use I don't need it. I could use a sturdier carrying case and maybe a slightly stronger vaccum, but even with those niggling complaints this is a great product.
  513. I bought this trimmer after my old Norelco stopped charging. For the record, I maintain a full beard with this. Overall, I am satisfied with the product, but there are some caveats. Vacuum: Like me, you may be interested in the included vacuum, rather than getting hair all over the place. It works pretty well for this! I'd say about 90% of the hair is trapped in the canister, about 3% on the sink, and about 7% left in my beard. For this reason, I recommend using the trimmer before you shower. Otherwise, you will get little hairs all over your shirt during the day. If you only have a goatee or similar, it may not be quite as bad. It's not much hair, but the little vacuum can't solve everything. Noise: The noise level is loud, but not really any noisier than an electric toothbrush. To me, it's really no big deal. With the bathroom door closed, you can only hear it when close to the door anyway. I even run it in turbo mode most of the time, and still don't have an issue with this. Of course it would be great if it were completely silent, but really it's not that bad. Trimming: Like all Norelcos, it does a great job trimming. The included adapter(s) handle just about everything I could imagine needing. I am a hairy guy, and have not felt any pulling or ripping of the hairs, just a clean trim. Power: I typically get several weeks worth of trimming (every 2-3 days) on a single charge. To maintain the battery, always ensure you fully drain it before recharging. Using turbo mode drains it slightly more quickly. I can go a whole vacation without needing to recharge, which is nice, but the included travel bag is handy just in case. So, overall I'd give it 4.5 stars, only because of the leftover hairs. It would be nice to have a slightly more powerful vacuum, but I realize it's difficult to get the hairs that are trapped in a beard. I love the trimmer, and have not seen anything else out there that would beat it.
  514. I like the concept of this trimmer with the vacuum and all, but I'm really annoyed that the people who make these things won't tell you what lengths the comb settings will trim to. Even if you go to a store to look at one, they have it all sealed in plastic that you have to cut open just to take a look at it. So I got this thing home to see if it would trim to my preferred length, and no it won't. I'm liking the stubble look, and about 3-4 days growth looks best on me. This trimmer only goes down to what represents 7-8 days growth for me. I have another Panasonic trimmer that works fine, but it has the same issue. I can take the comb off and cut the stubble down to about one day's length and then let it grow back a few days, but I'm getting really tired of doing that. I think these manufacturers should specify their trimming lengths so you can do a reasonable buying comparison.
  515. This trimmer has a wide variety of trim lengths, doesn't need to be charged frequently, is very comfortable to use, and even has a vacuum that makes clean-up VERY easy. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality, inexpensive beard trimmer (which I'd think would be anybody looking for a beard trimmer!)
  516. Only had it for a week or so but works great so far. Good design, wireless which is great, and fairly quiet. more to come
  517. I've only used it 2 times however it cuts nicely and has a small attachment which is nice for trimming and getting close to skin. I like the vacuum although it doesn't get 100% of hairs it does get most.
  518. I was a little dubious when I bought this. How many gadgets have you purchased that just didn't \\"do the do\\"? I read some reviews, and they were a bit mixed. However, the \\"thing\\" on my chin was getting out of hand and scissors just weren't cutting it (bad pun intended). So, I finally decided to give it a try. First pleasant surprise: Amazon shipping is pretty damn zippy. Second pleasant surprise: The thing does what it is supposed to. Yes, it's a little noisy, and , yes, you are going to have to clean up some hair off the sink. But aside from that, they've really worked out the details on this thing. It was pretty quick and easy to shape up my goatee and actually make it look presentable on the first try. I think it is a keeper.

  521. I had the previous (vacuum but non-turbo) version of this trimmer and after only a year, the battery life decreased to about 5 minutes (even though I don't keep it in the charger, let it discharge almost completely - all the proper care and feeding of a NiCad battery...). I generally liked the performance of the older one (except it didn't quite vacuum \\"all them tiny hairs\\" as Bill Cosby used to say) so I decided to replace it with this one. This is quite an improvement as far as vacuuming almost all the tiny hairs, which is to say, Norelco finally got the speed right. The only glitch is the Turbo switch is cleverly located so that one of my fingers or thumb inadvertently turns off the Turbo at least once per trim. Otherwise works great!
  522. I purchased this in March of 2010, about 21 months ago. I was never particularly impressed by the vacuum function. I'm sure it sucked in some of the hair, but whats the point if you still have to clean your sink? Recently it broke.   523. I bought this for my boyfriend so he'd keep his sexy new beard, and he was thrilled. The vacuum gets the vast majority of the hair, it's super easy to clean and keeps a charge well. He gets a cool gadget, and I get a bearded, manly beast of a lover. Highly recommend.
  524. This is an excellent trimmer, particularly with the vacuum feature. It cuts cleanly and consistently, far better than my old Braun.
  525. I had a Norelco T780 Vacuum Trimmer before this one that I returned to Norelco under warranty because of a defective battery issue.Kept maybe a 10min charge. Noreclo sent this one as a replacement.It is a nicer model. As far as trimming goes, does a fine job.I'm not a huge fan of the AccuControl System with flexing guide comb.Wish it were just a simple non flexing comb.I used to get a more precise shave from my oldest original trimmer especially near my moustache.To the nitty gritty. If you trim very very slowly, the vacuum feature does a pretty nice job of picking up probably 80-90% of the trimmed hair.If you work in real time, it's performance is sub par.If you use the turbo feature, it is still not that effective. You will get hair on your counter and freak out the wife if you haven't wiped them all away..This trimmer is probably one of the best out there though..
  526. I am happy with this purchase. The item was shipped on time and the price was copmparable and competetive.
  527. I have tried countless beard trimmers over the last ten years. I have tried trimmers made specifically for beards, trimmers made for cutting hair and everything in-between. The major complaints I had with all of these products were that a) they pulled my beard hair and hurt and b) were very messy and not at all precise. This T980 takes care of all of that. First of all, it's a well-made product. All the parts fit cleanly, the charger works well, the directions are great, the packaging is terrific. Secondly, it is easy to use with a cursory understanding of the instructions. It took me less than 20 minutes to read the instructions and trim my entire beard. The two things I like the most about this trimmer would be the vacuum feature (actually gets about 90% or more of the hair) and the smooth feeling it gives you when you use it. It does not pull, yank or grate your face at all. It makes beard trimming a very enjoyable experience. <br />
  528. <br />I've been using the Philips Norelco T980 for the last couple months. <br /> <br />There's a wide range of length settings. The vacuum works very well. Battery life is good. <br /> <br />A couple times the 'length dial' moved by itself, changing the closeness in the middle of the shave/trim. I realized I might have been pressing too hard and actually pushed the mechanism down inadvertently. This problem would not happen with a fixed blade trimmer. Overall, I'm very pleased. <br /> <br />I've used this product exclusively for beard trimming, but tried trimming my head once. The vacuum didn't work very well and I would recommend trimming your head over the sink. Besides the mess, it did a very good job.
  529. biggest complaints goes on the noise of the trimmer thanks to the vacuum and very unprecise cut of the beard
  530. The trimmer works reasonably well, and the vacuum on the high setting (why did they bother with a low?) gets almost all the hair. It's a little hard to take the guard on and off to trim the neckline. I have had no problems with the length setting sliding (I was worried about this from other reviews), and don't see how you could. Perhaps the manufacturing has changed slightly?
  531. Ok I took note of the reviews and some issues folks had with this model and I still purchased it. What is worse is even though I found that I disliked the same things as others I kept it, and only after the 60 day return did I decide I didn't really like it enough to use it. So I am at fault, but I don't want others to make the same mistake. The length setting is easily shifted while in use. There is a plastic part near the blades which moves up and down when pressed against your face, why not just have it stationary? I removed the plastic piece and then when I went without it I got the 5 o'clock look when I set it on a 3 which is odd. The vacuum does work well (when in turbo mode) but I really didn't need it. I donated it to the veterans, and I hope they get some use out of it. I then went to target and for 25 dollars (10 less) I purchased the remington mb-300, which is much like the old norelco I had but better in several ways. If anyone is thinking of purchasing the t-980 please reconsider and get the remington mb-300.
  532. I have owned the Norelco T980 for a few months now, and it is great. I had a previous Norelco model for about 4 years and finally it just stopped holding a charge so I bought the T980. With the old Norelco my wife used to complain about little hairs all over the sink. No more! It may not capture every single hair, but I would say it gets a good 90-95% of them. Regardless, it vacuums up enough of the hairs to keep my wife happy! In my mind the only two small items that keep it from being a 5-star product are: 1) it does not have a pop-up trimmer like my old model did - you have to take the regular blade off and put on the trimmer blade, but that is the price you pay for having the vacuum feature, and 2) its harder to get up close and trim under my nose - it can be done, it just takes more effort than before; again I think its the price you pay for the vacuum feature. Overall I have had great luck with Norelco trimmers and this one is no exception.
  533. I've been using a Norelco beard trimmer for years. I bought the first T100 which used 2 AA batteries. I've seen the improvements over the years and they have definitely added to how well the products functioned. Right off the bat I'll tell you my exception. This beard trimmer was made in China. That might not matter at all to some and you are entitled to your opinion. But it matters to me and I was slightly disappointed to see that they are not being made in Austria anymore.<br /><br />Other than that, I am impressed with this trimmer. The turbo vacuum system works great. I have not had to clean my bathroom sink even once. The self-sharpening blades no longer need to be lubricated with oil. Ever though this unit is slightly bigger than my last one (T990)it is not more awkward in my hands. Even the Accu Control System's flexing guide comb is easier to clean than the last one.<br /><br />I do have to recharge the battery after 2 or 3 uses but it does have a quick charge feature that takes about 1 hour. So I can't really complain about that.<br /><br />I have not noticed any problems with actually trimming my beard. The 9 lockable length settings have not slipped for me as others have reported (I am currently using a number 4). I have not had any problems with trimming under my nose but I have been used to using a Norelco.<br /><br />Some trimmers are still made in the USA like Wahl but some of the features in this Norelco I have not found in other trimmers like the vacuum trimmer feature. If this Norelco was still made in Austria I would have given it a 5 star rating. But other than that it is a good beard trimmer and I am enjoying using it.
  534. I chose this trimmer mostly because of the vacuum feature. Unfortunately the vacuum only captures maybe half the trimmings. I am not sure yet, but it seems to catch only the shortest cuttings. Also: The directions say that charging more than necessary will reduce battery life. Modern decent-quality rechargeable devices automatically prevent overcharging so you can plug it in and forget it. For the price this product should have that feature.
  535. I have a long beard, so I use the #9 setting. So far, this setting has not slipped to a lower setting, but I have been careful to avoid pressing the trimmer hard against my face. Beard trimming takes longer than I had expected. It takes time, and a lot of strokes to get all the hairs into the clipper teeth. The Turbo Vacuum does work well, and the chamber is large enough to hold about two weeks worth of hair growth. If you are not pressed for time, the T980 is a lot of fun to use.
  536. Works well, but has three flaws: Length setting selector moves too easily and slips in use 110 volts only clunky transformer on cord instead of built-in adapter. If you travel outside of North America, you have to carry a transformer with you to recharge this product.
  537. I recently grew a goatee and was looking for a no-nonsense, easy to use trimmer that would not break the bank and I found it with this product. I get a close trim, never pulls the hair on my face, easy to clean and no mess. I would recommend this to anyone.
  538. I bought the T980 to replace my old T760, which has a similar shape and size. Vacuum works well enough. I bet it would work even better if I didn't wait 2-3 weeks between beard trimmings. Still, the vacuum picked up probably 80% of my long hair with the turbo setting. That means a lot less cleaning up to do. Accu-Control is the reason I bought the T980. Just like my old T760 that I had for 5-6 years, you adjust the guard by twisting the zoom lock till you see the numbered setting you want. The twisting feature makes it hard to accidentally change mid trim. Corded/cordless-The instructions say that you should charge it only when dead, and charge it fully. The only thing that's difficult about that is you have to keep using it until the battery runs out, which makes having the corded/cordless feature necessary. If it's dead and I need to clip now, all I have to do is plug it in while I trim. Turbo really works well, even if it does make it louder (though not nearly as loud as a Wahl 9918C beard trimmer I had to use). I liked that the turbo not only boosted power to the vacuum, but also to the blades making a much more even and short cut the first time eliminating the need to do a second pass.
  539. I purchased the T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer as a replacement for a Norelco trimmer I had cherished for ten years. You become attached to the weight and feel of a trimmer and losing an old friend is hard. Finding a replacement is a risky challenge. The T980, however, fit the bill. The weight and feel are comparable, not bulky or heavy. The fine tuning length control works well, although I recommend you always start a little long and work down. The shortest setting will leave you with a \\"very\\" short stubble. The best innovation in that ten year time span is the vacuum system for the T980. No longer do I need to devote an additional 3 minutes to cleaning out the sink and counter after Trimming my beard. What a blessing. The one thing I should warn people of is the Trimmer's availability. I looked all over for the instrument in retail stores as I needed a trimmer post haste for a trip I was taking. Couldn't find it anywhere. Lots of lower price point Norelcos, but not the T980. Amazon was my salvation. You can save time by forgoing the retail search and buying direct from Amazon.
  540. Nothing beats turbo. There's no reason to even have the button. It should be the only setting. Ignore what people said about it jumping to other settings. That only happens if you're REALLY pressing this thing into your face, and there's no need for that unless you're Sasquatch. Battery life seems great so far. Attachable trim piece adds an extra space, but it works well and vacuums the hairs as well.
  541. I replaced an older model norelco vacuum trimmer with this one. The 'low battery' and smart 'charge' indicators are great. Really the only reason to replace my previous trimmer was that the battery no longer held a charge and the batteries are not replaceable. With the indicators on this trimmer, it is much easier to try and extend the life of the battery. Not to mention that the vacuum is much stronger on this newer model also. A lot less to clean up around the sink.
  542. My only other trimmer was a Norelco adjustable trimmer. So I can only compare it to that one. The T980 is much larger and trims quite well. You must replace the guard with a much smaller head that has exposed blades designed for this purpose.

  547. I find that the smallest setting--#1--does not give a real stubble shave. After about five-days without shaving, the trimmer would not cut anything when set at #1. The fact that it doesn't vacuum up all the hairs is, in my opinion, minor. It's not really loud either, when you consider how good it works. It does take a little training, but it is a great little tool.
  550. This is the best trimmer I have used. When on 'turbo' mode, the vacuum catches almost all hair.
  551. I am pleased with the product and its ease of use. The trim time takes less than one minute, and only seconds to clean the razor.

  553. This product does everything the manufacturer says and does it very well. You get a complete package of accessories too.
  554. I have it now for several years and using 2 to 3 times a week. Still works great. The only problem I have is the top flap on hair collecting chamber came off at the joint where it swivel.
  555. This product lived up to my expectations and continues to produce the desired results. Phillips makes a great line of trimmers.
  556. The vacuum really works.
  557. I have owned two previous \\"accu-vac\\" models. The vacuum always seemed kinda useless, mostly hype. <br /> <br />Well.....the \\"turbo\\" mode on this puppy REALLY vuccums! If you can tolerate the noise that the turbo mode produces, I would recommend using turbo mode at all times. If noise is a concern, like in early morning, the standard mode does an ok job too. <br /> <br />The price is right on this thing, and it LOOKS sweet. <br /> <br />95% mess free. Very Nice!
  558. If you are considering getting this trimmer, all you need to know is this: The 9 lockable length settings don't actually lock!! I tried putting it on length \\"3\\", but when I started to trim, it went down to length \\"2\\". Then I started on length 2 and it went down to length 1. Besides this, the cutting block is too far away from the thing that touches your face (not sure what it's called), so it's very hard to cut any hair at all unless you choose the length setting 3 or lower. I know all this may come as a surprise to those of you who have had success with previous Norelco trimmers, but the fact is that this thing is a serious piece of Sh_t. In my estimation, their aspirations to achieve the fancy \\"vacuum effect\\" has clouded what should be their primary goal with this device: to trim facial hair EVENLY and EFFECTIVELY! I would have given this 0 stars if it would have been an option.
  559. It does a nice job, but has way too many little, fragile parts. It needs to be built more simply, more durable, less prone to breakage.
  560. After years of trimming by beard over the waste basket, I now have a product that eliminates 99.9% of the hairs flying off the trimmer blades. So far I'm very satisfied with the product (after a couple of weeks of use). I don't find the noise of the turbo mode to be a problem at all. Highly recommended.
  561. This was purchased as a gift. I haven't heard any negative feedback from the receiver, so I guess it does well. The vacuum feature was much appreciated. I would give it an overall good rating.
  562. I had used another Norelco trimmer for many years and had been looking for a new one for some time. According to the Norelco site the T980 was the most popular seller, so I thought I'd give it a try. After nearly a month of use with this trimmer, I'm very pleased. The blades are very sharp which has resulted in cleanly cut whiskers. The vacuum does an exceptional job, especially in the turbo mode. Aditionally, the price I paid for the item with Amazon.com was around $20.00 cheaper than the other stores and sites I had shopped. Not to mention shipping was free.
  563. Unfortunately, Norelco really messed up what they had right to begin with. The length adjustment does not snap into place like my old Norelco trimmer and will shift while you are shaving. If you want to get a clean shave, go ahead and purchase this product, because that is exactly what you will have to do after using it. Disappointing build quality!
  564. I had a norelco trimmer I bought about 10 years ago that just finally ran out of breath. I figured there isn't much to a trimmer so it shouldn't matter what I get to replace it - wrong. I went through 3 other trimmers before I finnally went back to the norelco. This particular model had a built in vacuum - I figured it was more of a gimic than anything but I figured as long as it cut good I'd be happy and I was just plain curious about the vacuum part. To my surprise the vacuum actually works pretty good - if you keep a bushy beard you'll need to empty out the pouch a few times per trimming (it fills up pretty fast). If you are looking for a good dependable trimmer (that doesn't pull more hair than it cuts) I'd spend the few extra bucks and pick up the norelco.
  565. I am so mad about trying to register for this trimmer for warranty service on the Phillips Norelco web page that I can't actually say whether or not the trimmer is any good. When I refused to do the survey to register and complained through the webmaster contact I then get an answer back from Phillips wanting me to waste my time calling an 800 number for Norelco - we all know how those calls go!!   566. I bought this for my husband's birthday. I was skeptical after reading some of these reviews but decided to try it anyway. Well, I am certainly glad I did! My husband loves it. He was just using regular hair clippers before to trim his gotee and hair would get everywhere! Now with this trimmer he gets a much better trim and the hair is vaccumed up and never reaches the sink! It is awesome.   567. This is my first electric beard trimmer and it is great. I feel my experience is consistent with most reviews presented. The trimmer does a great job, is easy to adjust, and the vacuum function works very well. Again, does not get 100% of clippings, but I would say at least 80% are caught. One shortcoming is that this likely would not work well for long thick beards as the longest setting does not seem that long to me, but I'm just speculating since I keep my beard short so this is not a problem for me. I would definitely recommend this product.
  568. I travel a lot between two places and one of the things I bought for the 2nd place was this razor, so I wouldn't have to carry one back and forth. This razor impressed me so much I bought one for my 1st place to replace what I had been using.<br /><br />The major pros of this product: Solid feel, the vacuum feature definitely reduces the amount of hair in the sink (and on the counter, on the floor, etc.), the Turbo mode, while loud, is awesome. The razor cuts well, fast, and can do very straight lines (and I don't have very steady hands).<br /><br />There is at least one caveat, which other reviewers mentioned: For detailed, close trimming, you're cutting blind with this razor. I use a cheaper Norelco to even up corners and other tight spaces. Also, the power brick is a bit large, and there's no included charging base.<br /><br />However, the product works well, feels solid in my hands, and it looks cool :-). I have about 6 electric razors and I highly recommend this one.
  569. It's a pretty good trimmer but I like my old one better that broke after 10 years of good use. Unfortunately they do not make the Maverick anymore, so I brought this one as the closest thing. I like the vacuum and turbo function. Also the carrying case is convinent. Over all I would highly recommend it.
  570. The trimmer works pretty well. It trims my beard and moustache adequately and to the length I want, but not on first pass. Most of the trimmings make it into the collection chamber, but not all of them. I would say about twenty percent of the trimmings end up in the sink not the collection chamber. This is a replacement for me for a T990 Norelco trimmer, with a dead battery. I now have to disassemble that trimmer to get at and remove the dead battery for recycling. That is a problem with this trimmer too: it has a rechargeable but not replaceable battery. When the battery no longer takes a charge, as with my old trimmer, the trimmer will not run even when the cord is plugged in. I would prefer a trimmer that is corded, with no battery, or with a replaceable rechargeable battery. What Norelco has done is created a trimmer with built in obsolescence. When the battery is dead, the trimmer is done for. And batteries are not environmentally friendly.
  571. My Norelco T900 was great, but broke recently, so I went out looking for another one, only to find it was discontinued. Didn't see any Norelco trimmers comparible to my old trimmer. Bought a T980, took it home, and found out the first trim... its junk (I'm being nice with my wording). Overall, its too big to easily hold. Worst of all, the trim height setting moves when you press it against your face... so during my first trim, it ruined my goatee. Not a good trimmer, period. Too big, too much bling. I don't need a vacuum cleaner built into my trimmer.
  572. I have been using a Norelco T370 trimmer for several months. I bought it for the mini-shaver initially, decided to grow a beard, then trimmed the beard with the beard trimmer attachment. It did a great job of shaping and trimming, but left a mess of clippings in the sink. After reading a million reviews, I decided to try the T980 for it's vacuum feature.<br /><br />The T980 is great! It does a perfect job of trimming my beard evenly (setting at 7, ultimate beard length to be a 9). The best part is that about 90% of the clippings go into the vacuum receptical with only about 10% being lost. I have not come across any of the negatives (adjustment slips, tugs hairs and on and on) mentioned in other reviews. Unlike my T370, this trimmer lets you know when it's fully charged or about to go dead, and even if it does die in the middle of a session from a dead battery, plugging it in finishes the job. Most other trimmers only work when charged, not on house current.<br /><br />I can't think of anything this trimmer could do better. In my estimation it's looks, design and operation are flawless. The clipper works well on my beard's 'neckline' and the mini-trimmer keeps the bottom of my mustache trimmed perfectly. I really think the T370 does as good a job trimming as this one does, but will not run with a dead battery when plugged in, and does make a mess with beard clippings all over the place. For those two reasons alone, this trimmer is a BEST BUY!<br /><br />I am not putting the T370's abilities down in any way. For the price it can't be beat. It trims well and the mini-shaver is still the best way to shave the short hairs on my cheeks above my beard on a daily basis. I use it daily along with the T980 and will continue to. They both have their place. If you don't mind the beard trimmings everywhere, you will be happy with the T370, however if you are serious about perfect beard grooming (and I DO mean PERFECT), with none of the mess, both tools are a must.
  573. I've had a Norelco 8000 series shaver with a trimmer for awhile. When I grew a beard, I bought this unit based on the reviews I read here at Amazon. It's true that because of the vacuum, there is less hair in the sink. But the quality of its trimming is far below that on my Norelco shaver. If I'd known then what I know now, I would have passed on this item. It may be good for those who don't have a Norelco shaver with the trimming feature, (and don't want to pay a hundred dollars or more for such a shaver). But for those who have such a shaver, this product is, at best, superfluous. January 29, 2008 It's not even a year later, and it has broken already. I'm not a happy camper.

  589. Out of the box, one of the best looking trimmers that is offered. however, this is not why i buy a beard trimmer in the first place. i need my beard trimmed. i charge the t980 up in about an hour and go at it. it comes to life with the expected amount of noise and vibration. i hit turbo to see what that is all about. it seems to double its rpm. the trimmer works flawlessly, as though the blades were sharp and efficient. the vacuum is a nice touch. but curly beard hairs have a mind of their own. when cut, they seem to want to escape the suction. turns out the vacuum gets about 90% of the hairs -certainly better than nothing. it has an easy to read dial to adjust the length of your cuts. light and ergonomic, i give it my recommendation.
  590. This my 4rd trimmer in 15 years and by far the best yet. Love the vacumn collection space as the mess leaves very little cleanup.

  592. We bought this to replace a 6 year old Norelco trimmer with a dead battery. It works quite nicely, just as the previous trimmer worked nicely. With that said, the introduction of the vacuum and \\"turbo\\" mode seem really unnecessary. Our experience has been that little bits of hair still fly all over the place, even with the vacuum--although perhaps to a slightly lesser degree. I haven't found the \\"turbo\\" mode to be that helpful. From my perspective, it seems to be a marketing tool designed to convince guys that they're getting a really powerful, studly shaver. Power in a car, I can understand. But in a trimmer? Anyway, this is a great little trimmer. I just question the degree to which the new features are improvements.

  596. I've never used it without turning Turbo on, so I don't know what the regular is like. I've used it about seven or eight times so far and still haven't recharged it from it's initial charge. The length adjuster is very nice, much nicer than my old crappy walmart cheapie. However, I kept the cheapie because it cuts a little bit closer without a guard than this one does. And this way I don't have to remove the guard. I usually use setting 1 for a close, stubble plus a little more look, and then shave my neck clean. Easy and convenient. The Vacuum feature is nice, as it gets 98% of my hair. I now stand at the sink, instead of in the (dry) tub with a hand held mirror. Very little cleanup. It cuts very smooth! I'll see how it holds up over time, but for now it's very nice, no pinching, no pulling. Many people complained about the noise, I don't think it's that bad. The only complaint I have is that the guard is pretty big and it's tough to trim my mustache without jamming the thing up against my nose.
  597. 'Tornadoes' super warm beard trimmer and nose waxer was developed in the climates of Southern Arabia where men are known to never shave. This contributes to dry, coarse membranes which develop into flat tender sources for infection. This invention, a godsend, trims a beard, or shaves it all off, with the touch of a button and it also is great for bald patchy spots on top of the head.
  598. The Norelco T-980 price was not much more than the cost of replacing the battery in my 10-year old Norelco Maverick T-3000 and I was excited about the addition of a vacuum feature. Be careful what you wish for! The vacuum does its job and sink cleanup is definitely faster. But the vacuum feature tends to obscure your view of the blade edge making it much trickier to aim the thing at your beard's edge while looking in the mirror. The vacuum must be emptied by using thumb pleasure to disengage one side of a rather flimsy, curved compartment cover that swings open on a hinge that looks so weak that I'm afraid it's just a matter of time before I accidentally break either the hinge or snap the cover in half. Equally delicate-feeling are the two sliding, plastic prongs used to hold the primary blade in place. Yet it must be removed each time one wants to use the smaller, more accurate trimming blade. And of course the trimming blade uses similar prongs to hold it in place. My older T-3000 had a self-contained trimming blade that slid forward with a simple thumb push whenever needed and then retracted just as easily. The T-980 is larger around and heavier than the older unit... enough so that I really miss the sense of control and precision I was used to. In short, the T-980 feels clumsier, less maneuverable, and less accurate. It takes longer to complete the job due to the hassle of changing the regular blade and the trimming blade. And it really tries my patience having to be so careful not to beak one of those delicate, sliding, plastic prongs or the vacuum-compartment cover. I'm really tempted to pay the $30 it will cost to restore my old T-3000.
  599. No good for a goatee.It won't fit under ones nose for mustache trimming. It's just to big and bulky. Might be good for shearing sheep. Don't be fooled by the money back guarantee, you still have to pay for shipping and insurance.

  601. Well in today corporate world I'm really surprised when the product actually is what the advertisement say. The most surprising part is that the vacuum pump really does the job. It's not perfect but I'd say 95% at turbo mode. Should be transparent. Also doesn't have base and can't be put upright. (did I mention corporate thinking). Other than that is a good product. Definitely much better than Wahl at double price.   602. i love the fact that it has a vacuum on it. now there is no mess. definately worth buying.
  603. Like many other reviewers, I experienced the annoying nuisance of the trimmer length setting decreasing with normal pressure applied while trimming. This is really a huge problem. I have cut my beard too short twice as a result of this design flaw. Norelco should send us out new trimmers, guys! I also agree that the vacuum is a waste, as unless it retains most of the hairs (which it doesn't), you still have to clean up the sink. Finally, having to manually change out the trimmer head to trim your mustache, ears, etc is a pain, and really not all that easy. I like the older design with a flip-out small trimmer head for the latter functions. The T980 is an example of \\"newer is definitely not better\\". Back to the drawing board, PLEASE, Norelco.
  604. I was skeptical about whether or not the vacuum would be able to get most of the falling hair, but it does a very good job. There is still a little bit of hair that gets to the counter, but maybe 1/100th of the total amount trimmed.

  607. i bought this to keep my beard nice and trim and it works GREAT.   608. The trimmer works very well however the vaccume does not collect much. The vaccume does help pull your beard from your face which results in an even trim but if you are looking for a trimmer that requires no clean up afterwards this is not it.
  609. fantastic product. i'm very picky, and this trimmer lacks in no area. not noisy at all. no mess. many settings to get just the right length. very, very pleased with this purchase.
  610. Design flaw #1:<br />The \\"lockable\\" length settings don't lock. So if you apply a normal amount of pressure to the device, your number 5 beard setting will be pushed down to a number 1. They should've built some sort of locking switch onto this thing.<br /><br />Design flaw #2:<br />When you remove the trimmer guard to just use the trimming blade itself for detail trimming, the blue plastic vacuum guard blocks the trimming blade. You have to push it against your hair line for the plastic guard to move out of the way. Trying to catch the hair is good, but this is not a good design for precise trimming.<br /><br />Design flaw #3:<br />They give you an additional smaller trimming blade for detail work on the moustache, but it isn't built into the trimmer, so you have to remove the outer guard, remove the inner trimming blade, usually clean out all the hair, then attach the new trimming blade. My old trimmer had a switch that just caused a smaller trimmer blade to pop out, so I didn't have to remove all of the other stuff this trimmer makes you remove. That would've been a better design.<br /><br />Design flaw #4:<br />The on switch is just a big button you press down on and not a switch. So if you want to stick this in the supplied travel bag and into your suitcase, expect it to accidentally turn on. You can also accidentally turn it off while shaving if you don't watch your grip. A better design would've been a switch.<br /><br />Design flaw #5:<br />Since it's a vacuum, it has a hair reservoir. They did one good thing this time and actually made the beard reservoir window clear. But it's not removable and it's just a door that opens up - so it's harder to clean out. Also, the hair reservoir isn't big enough and if you have a moderate or heavy beard, you'll find yourself cleaning this trimmer out every time you use it (which is what it recommends in the manual). Who has time for that?<br /><br />The vacuum doesn't catch enough hair for it to be worth all of the inconveniences of its design flaws. Maybe one day they can get this design right. Until then, save your money and use a regular shaver with replaceable trimming attachments and put down a paper towel to catch the hair.s design right. Until then, save your money and use a regular shaver with replaceable trimming attachments and put down a paper towel to catch the hair.

  614. This trimmer is probably one of the best ones I have ever owned. The vacuum is probably the best part - everyone knows how much hair goes everywhere when you trim your beard, but this one significantly cuts down on that.   615. I purchased this trimmer in March 2009 to replace an older Norelco T770 model trimmer whose battery was dying. I have been using the T980 regularly (roughly weekly) since then and am very happy with it. The T980 is a nice upgrade. It looks and feels sturdier than the older T770. I used to have trouble with the older model T770; the dial that regulates how close a trim you get would slip a notch. I haven't had that issue with the new trimmer at all. The vacuum works well and the vacuum compartment is easy to empty and clean. To clean out the drive compartment you must still remove the trimmer head and use the included brush. I can't comment on the Turbo setting because I haven't really used that; for me it works just fine at the normal setting. Battery life so far has been good, noticeably better than the older model even when it was new. So far, with my weekly usage I've only had to do 2 charges since the initial one.
  616. I've been using this trimmer for about 5 months. Overall, this is a good but not great personal appliance. Yes, it trims quite well and holds a charge for an acceptable number of uses. But product design could be better. I'm always inadvertently pressing the poorly placed on/off switch. However, the trimmer's phallic-like shape is good for a laugh with the ladies. The \\"Turbo\\" feature is simply a marketing gimmick. Happily, a gas compressor used for forced-induction of an internal combustion engine is not to be found here. This battery powered device does not have an internal combustion engine. Duh! The \\"turbo\\" feature generates a little more noise and vibration. The ladies like that too.
  617. I bought this to replace a cheaper Philips Norelco product that I bought a while back. I wanted to get away from having a bunch of attachments, a bulky base station, and hair all over the sink. This trimmer does pretty much everything I wanted.<br /><br />While the trimmer itself is a little bigger than most, it charges with just a power cord and has only one precision attachment. This makes it incredibly easy to store and keeps it out of the way. The vacuum built into the trimmer works pretty well, with the \\"regular\\" or \\"non-Turbo\\" mode successfully capturing most of the hair that's trimmed off. A small amount of tiny trimmings does fall in the sink, but turning on Turbo does fix this.
  618. I've owned the T980 for 6 weeks now and am very satisfied. I'd buy it again. Product works very well. I was skeptical about the vacuum, but it really does the job keeping the bathroom clean. Powerful. Holds a charge well. Guard is sturdy. No complaints. The manual says it's only for 110v, but I took it to Spain and charged it with no problems. (It needs a plug adapter for this, but otherwise it worked fine for me.)
  619. I bought this trimmer to replace an aging Wahl trimmer that could no longer hold a charge. I have been very happy with the design of this machine, the settings adjustments, the vacuum for clippings- just about everything. I have already gotten 7 trims out of the initial charge.
  620. For everyone's information: I got mine in August 2009 and it came with a \\"universal\\" charger (110-240V) that works overseas. Awesome!
  621. After reading the negative reviews on this trimmer I was worried about the adjustable guard height because the folks rating this product with one star that was their biggest complaint. I can only assume that Norelco heard those issues because the locking mechanism on mine is very solid. I use a little bit of force to try to change and it did not budge. The vacuum is also more powerful than the previous Remington model I had. Although I did like the hair collection system on the Remington better. I little drawer pulled out that you could easily dump out in the basket and wash out if desired. The first time I opened the Norelco compartment I was holding the device vertical and the hair clippings spilled out. Now that I know, it is not that big of deal, just not optimal. I like the Norelco's sleek design and the feel of it in my hand. However, I liked the way the Remington could sit on the sink counter in the vertical position, taking up less counter space.
  622. Very fast with little (if any) cleanup required thanks to the built-in vacuum functionality. Would have been great if it came with a stand; just an opportunity for improvement. Amazon price was significantly less than retail (25%). Great shaver for beard or goatee.
  623. Unfortunately I have to agree with some of the more critical reviews of this product. I say unfortunately, because the vacuum actually works pretty good when the unit is new. But ask those people who rave on and on about this unit how well their trimmer is working after a few months use and i bet you will get a totally different answer. The suction power substantially decreases after a few months of use it and it drops clumps of hair every where. And this is despite cleaning the unit thoroughly after each use. There are just too many other problems with this trimmer to recommend it. Most namely, it keeps breaking. I'm on my fifth unit in 3 years. Luckily it does have a 2 year warranty and Philips/Norelco has been terrific at replacing them. But, still, this continually breaking is a problem. I think this is mostly due to the cheap plastic build. I also agree with another review in regards to the ON/OFF and Turbo buttons being in a bad location. Because these buttons are where the fingers naturally sit to hold the trimmer I'm constantly, unintentionally, turning the trimmer off. This is very annoying. And I too have had the unit change to a shorter setting during use. Also very annoying.
  624. I have been using a generic Wahl trimmer for the past two and a half years, and have always complained about it because it would always leave my beard completely uneven around the jawline and by my sideburns. I decided it was finally time to just go for it and get a new one, and based on the reviews of this trimmer I decided to try it out. I just used it last night, and I'm completely happy with it. It's the first time I had a completely even shave--including my jawline and the vacuum works better than I expected. Of course it did not catch all of the hair; however, I would say it got about 90% of it which really eased the clean up. The nine settings lock into place which is nice (and was an improvement over my previous trimmer, which would slip into lower settings now and again), and it is possible to take the comb off and do detailed trims with the detail blade included. The only criticism that I have is that the blade doesn't work too well to do extreme details because of the bulkiness of the unit, but for me the rest of the package more than compensates for this. I definitely recommend this trimmer.
  625. Good at sucking up hair. Depth gauage works well. Other options for triming around lips good.
  626. My son had an earlier model of this Phillips Norelco trimmer and wanted another of the same when his finally died. He wouldn't consider anything other than another Norelco. He was thrilled to get the new version for Christmas and was happy that the new features make it even better than the original.
  627. I bought my husband a Philips Nnorelco T980 Turbo Vacuum [beard]Trimmr, for Christmas. He had asked for a new beard trimmer and I was happy to oblige. The reason I chose this particular one, is that it vacuums up the bits of beard rather than finding them in the sink. As a result, there are two happy people in our home. Husband is getting the control and settings he likes for his beard and mustache. I am not finding beard hair in the sink, or clogging the pipe. Very pleased with this choice and happy to recommend it to anyone considering purchasing a new trimmer.

I have already paid for the trimmer, because with the vacuum feature, I can shave my head easily myself, saving $19:00 per head-shave. I don't understand or use the turbo feature. Everything moves faster, unnecessary in my view, and it is very noisy. Here's to a quieter world. The trimmer is rechargeable. I don't know whether it will be possible to replace the battery. Ian Yeomans

  633. Got this as a replacement for a 10+ year old Conair beard trimmer that finally was unable to hold a charge anymore. My only real requirement was that it had to be able to be used corded OR cordless, for those times when you realize you shouldn't look like a deadbeat just as you are about to walk out the door, only to find out that the unit needs charging! The beard cutting is very uniform, seems to be plenty of height adjustment settings, and about 95% of the trimmings magically got sucked into the little chamber instead of all over my bathroom counter, which is a huge boost for my marriage! Feels a little plastic-y, not cheap but not as solid as my old unit - will be fine if you are not an equipment trasher and as long as you pay a little attention when sliding the moveable pieces off and on and make sure you have them in the right groove. I researched several alternatives but came back to the PN due to price and my experience with the previous version. The T980 does all I ask it to: I clip my goatee 2x per week and with this usage the battery lasts about a month. I haven't felt the need to use the turbo button so that might be contributing to the good battery life. The clipper is a little loud but nothing out of the ordinary for a clipper in general. It hasn't snagged a hair yet, it cuts clean and true. It's not only a beard trimmer, but it will edge for you too, so you can get a nice clean neck line or shape up your sideburns. There are no attachments for me to otherwise misplace or lose. It is easy to pick up and start operating as soon as it's charged the first time. The \\"turbo\\" button turns up the speed of the trimmer, but I can't think of a reason why I would ever need to do that. I like this trimmer. All of the reviews and articles that I read online pointed me to this particular grooming tool. I know there are other big names in beard trimmers, but I am glad I chose the T980. Seems to have a nice long battery life too; I don't have to charge it up every time I get done using it. Great beard trimmer.

That's why when I say it sucks, I mean that in the best of ways. Now worth 5 stars. It is now mid September and I can report that this is just wonderful. Shaving has always been one my life's peeves and growing a beard was a way to avoid that but then trimming and upkeep became a new peeve. Suddenly I have this wonderful piece of equipment that makes all of that child's play. One setting for the length, go over it a few times each week in minutes, another setting for a few other areas and usually no clean-up thanks to the vacuum. I admit that I use my old electric razor for the trim around the mouth and the part of the cheeks kept clean, takes a few seconds, and maybe every 2 weeks a couple of minutes with a safety razor to make sure that the clean area hasn't shrunk. A joy to use, no peeve, looks like this time the beard will stay. Oh yes, no problems to report with the way it works, the fit of the guard and the shaving heads. I recommend it highly.

  668. I've used the T980 for a year and a half and it still works great. I've tried several trimmers and a couple that claimed a vacuum ablility, most failed miserably. Most others also felt like junk compared to the T980's construction. The T980's vacuum actually DOES work very well...with a couple of caveats. You must switch it to turbo mode to be effective, and if you're trimming more than a light amount of hair you need to dump out the cut hair once or twice (which is easy to do with the way it is made) for the vacuum to still work effectively. Great quality product and the storage pouch is such a nice simple touch but so very handy. UPDATE 2/2012: 3 years of use and still works well. Battery quit holding a charge a month ago, but that was not unexpected. One reason I bought this model was that it will work corded even after the battery quits holding a charge.

  689. If we're completely honest, we've been conditioned by manufacturers these days to accept rubbish without complaint. Quite true, you can dial into their computer and navigate circles around their voicemail system for a few hours until your anger dissipates. Or is transferred to computer answering systems. Whichever comes first. Happily, however, such is not the case with the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer. Not only does this eager little trimmer solve several problems at once but it does so with a composure and aplomb that will sweep away the corporate fog and, suddenly, everything else you own will seem completely and utterly inadequate. Trimming whiskers used to be such a chore that the ZZ Top look began to show some sense, if not appeal. The constant recharging, sweeping up afterward, seemingly endless search for single-tasking components that had wandered off and an assembly/disassembly process for cleaning the tool that would make Bill Gates weep. Philips, however, decided to go in a slightly different direction. For a start, the battery holds on to a charge with a grip that would make Chuck Liddell cry. It doesn't last mere hours, days or weeks. Under standard use, mine lasts well over a month. Even when the battery light does begin to blink, what it really means to say is, \\"Pardon me but, at some point in the next several days, when it isn't too much of a bother, could you please plug me in for a bit?\\" Nothing urgent about it whatsoever. And once the lead is connected from socket to trimmer, a scant hour will have it fully refreshed and ready for another month on the road. Then there is the all-in-one design. Unlike most trimmers, which require that you dig around to find the correct attachment in order to trim your left eyebrow now that you're done with the right, nearly everything is built directly into this sleek little unit. The only exception is a neat little detail trimmer that stands eternally at the ready in itsown clear and obvious pocket inside the travel pouch. That's it. Nothing else to search out when you're dashing to work. It's all right there. Not everyone who sells a \\"vacuum trimmer\\" truly means it. Most generate just a bit of wind, sufficient to scatter your whiskers over the widest possible surface. I firmly believe my last vacuum trimmer was designed by a consortium of housekeepers seeking job security. The T980, however, actually captures every single whisker, every single time. And then there's a Turbo button that doubles the already adequate force of the vacuum's suction so that you can give yourself that wind-blown look if you so choose. But, by far, my favorite thing about this trimmer is the way it feels. It sits in your hand as if it were custom designed specifically for you. It's lightweight and nimble around the bends, falls effortlessly into its case when deeds are done and assembles as if there is an invisible force guiding your hand at every step of the way. I am genuinely amazed at the simplicity of removing and replacing the grille guard. For a time, I thought it must be drawn together by magnets. But it isn't. It's just a set of exceptionally well designed tabs and slots that quickly correct a hurried approach and seat the grille home with a satisfying, subtle click. Most products on the market today are slapdash clumps of flimsy plastics and mechanics that are carefully designed to fail at the worst possible time. And, for some reason, we have accepted this corporate abuse in the hopes that prices would compensate us somehow. But they don't really, do they? When you've re-purchased the same device five times because it keeps breaking, whose interests are truly being served? So, then, the T980 is a warning shot fired over the bow of companies everywhere who treat their clients like stupid, slobbering monkeys, devoid of choice or rights. With it, Philips is saying, \\"See, everyone? You needn't accept rubbish in exchange for your hard-earned money. We've done it properly and at a price point that is competitive.\\" And why wouldn't we honor that? I wish my hair grew faster.
  690. I've owned this quite a few years now, and it's still going on the original battery. It does a good job of collecting the trimmings, but it won't capture 100%. It seems the shorter the hair trimmings, the better it does at capturing them. When I go long periods of time between trimming, the long hairs tend to clog up the port that feeds into the hair collector. It's a little bulky, so getting the hairs under the nose takes just a little more effort.<br /><br />Recently I dropped the trimmer, and trying to catch it accidentally slammed it onto the tile countertop. Pieces went flying everywhere, and I thought I had to buy another one. After picking up the half-dozen pieces, I found that none were broken and I was able to assemble the trimmer back to normal working order.
  691. The blades on this are not very sharp, and the length adjustment collapses when in use. I would not recommend this trimmer.
  692. great machine, had the previous version and that was great this works just as well
  693. Functionally, this trimmer worked fine. Not even sure they make it any more. However, I have a problem when the design philosophy is based on designed obsolescence. When the rechargeable battery on this unit (and I owned two of them over the years) finally failed to recharge the product's life is over. I does have a cord but won't run off a wall outlet if the battery won't recharge. I've been left with two perfectly mechanically functional beard trimmers that will no longer run because of the design. I find such design decisions reprehensible from an environmental perspective, and shady from a business perspective.<br /><br />Has Norelco fixed this in their more recent models? Don't know. I won't buy the brand any more.
  694. Well-designed, Easy to use cutter height adjustments. Reliable, easy to clean. I threw away several cheap, battery-operated, trimmers before getting this, which I've had for quite a while.
  695. This trimmer has to be one of the best trimmers that I have ever owned. It's quick, easy to use, and the adjustable settings make it very versatile. The fact that it can be used while plugged in or cordless is also a plus. It's definitely the trimmer to get if you're in the market for a new one.
  696. I purchased this to replace a 3.5 year old Norelco T990 when its batteries died. I *loved* the T990 and would buy it again, but it's no longer available. (The current T765 is a similar design to the T990.) T980 issues: The electronic power and turbo switches are touch sensitive and too easy to press while trimming. The settings window is tiny and it's hard to read the number. The mini trimmer is an inconvenient attachment. When using the trimmer without the comb/guide, like for neck cleanup, the vacuum tube blocks your view of the cutter. These were enough to make me return the trimmer to Norelco with their 60-day return policy. There was also an issue that may be a defect in the trimmer I received. It would not hold the selected setting. While using it, it would change to a shorter setting! Yikes! I ended-up replacing the batteries in my beloved T990 for about the same price as the T765. Unless you must have the vacuum and one-hour charge time, buy the less expensive T765. [[ASIN:B0001HYL0M Philips Norelco T765 AccuTrim Beard and Moustache Trimmer]]
  697. This works very well. I had a different brand before and this one works great. I shave my face and head with it and it does a nice job. However, it only works well in Turbo mode and it feels like it will fly apart at any minute in Turbo mode.
  698. This trimmer, overall, works very well and is a great buy for the money. The vacuum picks up about 75-80% of all the hair that falls but WILL not pick up everything. The blade works great and the trimmer piece is very sharp which helps for precise cutting. The plastic trimmer guide which guides the blade thickness is not that great but it is a small problem that doesnt really diminish the overall usefullness of the product.
  699. It trims well and the vacuum really works. I have a heavy beard and have to empty the collection chamber often but yes the vacuum really works. It is functional and handy and trims well. I would give it 5 stars but I don't like changing the head for moustache trimming. Those that complain about the battery life probably didn't charge it fully and use it until the charge was depleted before re-charging. All and all another good Norelco.
  700. I like this trimmer. The turbo vacuum catches most of the hair, though not all, especially when switching from the accessory heads. I can now trim my beard at the sink with a fraction of the cleanup that was required with my old trimmer that didn't have a vacuum. I really like the \\"specialty Mini-Beard trimmer attachment\\" which allows me to easily shape my beard and moustache while still using the vacuum. That was one of my hesitations before purchasing the trimmer, but it has exceeded my expectations. Overall, I'm pleased with my purchase and the value I've recieved for the money spent.
  701. This unit does an entirely adequate job of beard trimming. The settings match up well with those from earlier units and, once set, there is no slippage from one setting to another. In my estimation, the \\"turbo\\" feature adds no functionality, only noise and increased battery drain. The new vacuum feature allows for the capture of only about 60-70% of the hair trimmed. A potential positive is not having to oil the blades, but only if this does not shorten product life. And as with the last trimmer I owned, the NiCad battery is not replaceable, but it should be. The battery is the size of a standard AA but it is soldered in place. Directions are given as to how to remove the battery prior to disposal, but Norelco could have gone the final step and made the battery replaceable. My old trimmer worked fine; only the battery needed replacing. But then again, I would guess that product longevity does not rise high on the list of marketing features.
  702. I had some hesitation as to whether or not to buy this from reading some of the reviews. I'm glad I did. The vacuum picks up 95% + of the hair it cuts. You do need to take some care in locking in the length setting. You can not use it by holding the length setting dial or by the trimmer attachments. Many people complained that these either shifted or fell off. I have not had a problem yet. If you use some caution in how you hold it, it works great. It takes only about 3 - 5 minutes to trim my entire beard & moustache. I would recommend this product.
  703. 20 years of beard trimming and this unit is the best trimmer used. The trimmings are quick and clean. A built-in vacuum sucks 95% of the wiskers into a small cup that is easily emptied. This also creates a noticeable breeze on the face. Negatives are the lightweight construction where it would probably explode if dropped from counter?
  704. When I retired, I decided to grow a beard. I read the Amazon reviews and bought a T980. It is used twice a week to trim a short beard with the length adjustment set on three (my old eyes find the number a little hard to read without glasses). Length adjustment never changes. Turbo mode is never used. I seldom see even a stray hair on my towel or sink. Recharging has been done six times and unplugged when full charge is reached. I bought in spite of some bad reviews. Now, the criticisms baffle me. The purchase was made with confidence, because it came with a 90 day return guarantee. I haven't a clue about reviewers who abandoned or threw away the trimmer when it didn't work for them. It will be more economical than a 5 blade razor if it only lasts about year. It fits my hand well and is easy to use for thorough trimming. I like it!
  705. For the price this beard trimmer works extremely well. It took a little getting used to because of the floating cutting head but once I started using it properly it does a great job of trimming quickly and evenly.
  706. I've gone thorugh many beard trimmers and electric shavers, this one is TOPS! I love the vacuum, it even gives a bit of a coolin effect. There is little to no mess and the bettery life is amazing, love the travel ouch and small wal charger. Best gift ever!

  709. I bought this trimmer because of it's built in guard and vacuum capabilities. I've been using it about once a week for the past 4-5 months and have been extremely satisfied so far. It does not catch or pull while trimming and I've had no difficulties with the guard slipping to a lower setting as others have reported.<br />The vacuum works great catching most of the trimmings. It does leave a few trimmings on the sink but those are few enough to simply rinse down the drain with no worries.
  710. Excellent razor and beard trimming device...however this little bad boy has a tendency to change its clipper size mid-trim with a gentle nudge against the face. I had to duct tape mine to make sure that this doesn't constantly happen. Since then, I have been very satisfied with this product.
  711. Update:I've now owned this trimmer for 6 years. It still runs amazingly well with no maintenance! The battery life is still great even with the age and thousands of uses. When this one dies, I'm buying another. I don't understand how you can not see what you are shaving due to the blue guard. I have zero trouble. I don't understand how you can reset your level by pressing it agains your skin. During my test, I applied 12 pounds of pressure without ever resetting or reverting to a lower level thusly chewing up my facial hair. If it is too loud, you are too picky. This is a fine trimmer with no serious draw backs. Some people are just too eager to complain and be negative. Don't bother with the negative feeback. Buy this product. It will serve you very well...unless you are a finicky turd.
  712. This is just a great product!!! It's a bit loud, but so are most trimmers....It came completely dead with no power at all, after like 20 minutes it ran at full power for about 30 min and didn't even start to slow down! all in all, i give it a B+
