  719. I've had the product for about 2 weeks now and have used it about 6 times. This is the first trimmer I have used. It provides a very clean trim, and the vacuum feature makes this product worthwhile over others (from what I can assume). The benefit of having one-size cuts all is very nice, but a trimmer with interchangeable trimming lengths would probably be more sufficient. The rotating zoom on this sometimes moves slightly out of place which changes the length of the trim slightly (my neurosis brings this to my attention since I prefer everything to be precise). I typically charge it while I am in the shower and then remove the charger to trim (it holds charge very well). Having a wireless trimmer makes it easier to maneuver. Shaving while plugged in often makes it slightly more difficult to use. Overall, this is a great product, granted I've only used it a limited number of times. My suggestion, if you're neurotic about trim length, is to look around and find a trimmer with trimming attachments for varying lengths because of the occasional twist of the zoom feature that changes the trimming length.
  720. This thing is super powerful. The first time I used it I had turn on the power thinking it was in Tubro mode and accidentally hit the \\"turbo\\" button this and was like what the heck. The shave is much more enjoyable on this. I'm glad I spent the little extra. This puppy is good. The vacuum catches about 80% of the hair which is really nice. And, unlike most trimmers in this price range don't allow you to use the cord when the battery gets low. That is a very good thing. I would spend the extra $20 for this trimmer any day.
  721. Very good shaver. This is about my 4th electric shaver. I have a short beard and this is by far the best shaver I have had. I like the fact that as I cut my beard the shaver vacuums the cut hair so there is not big clean up at the end of the trim. I hope the battery holds out longer than my others.
  722. Now that I bought and used the T980, my cool slacker goatee is attracting too many women. I'm not getting any rest. Naturally, a product that causes grief should be down-rated, but I won't here because this shaver is just doing its job. And, we all like things with \\"turbo\\" in the description, however loosely that term is applied. It makes it go faster with a cool noise, so even in a shaver that is attractive to many. Electric shavers for beards sure beat the heck out of scissors! The Norelco has a wide range of cutting depths and my beard comes out a uniform length. I did not feel any pulling or other discomfort. The charge seems to last for days and the charger itself, like the shaver, is a decent and modern design. The little detail cutter is easy to attach and does a great job of defining the beard area and also clipping any stray hairs under the nose where the big cutter head cannot reach. Some people think the closest cutting position is still not close enough for that short-stubble look and that does seem to be the case. I don't want mine that close, but I understand those who do and I take off a star for brotherly solidarity. Actually, I'm sure that if it was to cut more closely, that would take it into the realm of regular shavers, an expensive world of high-tech blades and lubricants. Actually, if you press down a little, you can get closer. The turbo thing works well. It vacuums almost every hair into the storage chamber. I didn't expect the vacuum action to work so well. I think the turbo button should be the only button, but there it is. The non-turbo setting is less noisy... The parts detach easily and the little supplied brush works well to clean it out. The little travel pouch is nice. The T980 works just as it should, for me, and the price is reasonable. I think it will last a long time and I am glad I bought it. As for the women, I did exaggerate. One did make a favorable comment which is one more than before. That is animprovement, eh?
  723. The vacuum works better on this one than my older Norelco. I'm not sure why I need to press 2 buttons to get the good vacuum speed. Fast and easy to use. When putting the comb back on the trimmer, make sure it responds to the height adjustment ring. It's all too easy to put the comb on wrong which is typical of the Norelco beard trimmers.
  724. I purchased this trimmer to deal with the upkeep of a newly grown beard. A feature that I like is that you adjust the cutting length with the turn of a dial, not by changing heads. As advised in the operating manual, I started with a longer length and worked my way down to a setting that fit what I wanted by simply turning a dial. This trimmer also comes with a separate head to trim sideburns or a mustache--straight cut trimmer. The head is easy to change and works well. The vacuum feature of this model works! Almost all the trimmings get sucked into a small chamber that is viewable and easy to clean. The vacuum collection certainly helps keep the sink area clean. One last comment-- the rechargeable system works well--- battery holds charge and recharges quickly. I am very satisfied with this trimmer.
  725. My DH loves his trimmer. He uses it more often than the one he had previously. He would highly recommend it.
  726. I bought this trimmer in 2009 and have been using it every week since. It is easy to handle and provide a comfortable clean cut. However it is very hard to clean.   731. I purchased the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum Trimmer a year and a half ago, so I now have some experience using it. Previously, I've owned two Panasonic trimmers/clippers. Both worked well for a number of years, but eventually suffered from the same problem; the battery lost the ability to hold a charge. When this happened to the first trimmer, I had the battery replaced locally; the replacement battery did not hold a charge as well. When the second failed similarly, I purchased the Norelco. It was a tough decision to purchase the Norelco instead of another Panasonic. However, the Panasonic models readily available differed from those I had used previously and the Norelco had good reviews and a nice price. I was also a fan of the understated styling and Japanese build of the Panasonic units, so this Norelco was a bit of a departure. I don't recall the exact model number for the Panasonic, but something similar to the ER389K or ER205. Overall it's served me well for the past year and a half. So, time to share my thoughts. The Norelco is built in China; I haven't noticed any quality problems as of yet. Positives: --------- Vacuum is a great improvement. It's much less messy to use this trimmer than those I used in the past. Power is sufficient, even without the boost. Battery (still pretty new) holds a charge for a long period of time and recharges relatively quickly. Comb stays in position (one of the older Panasonic could switch to a lower position under pressure). Negatives: --------- It's loud. Bothersome enough for me that I put insert earplugs before using. The circumference is large; it's a pretty large clipper. I'd prefer something more narrow. Difficult to replace to guard if you remove it. Brush falls out of small compartment in case (will be easy to loose it someday). Possible for pressure to turn on clipper when in soft case; it's happened to me. Gaudy looks. Why does it need shinny highlights?
  732. These are okay but the plastics are prone to failure in small details that are required of a complicated device. Frustrating. Contour feature of beard comb no longer contours and door to hold hair opens at will. Expect 1-2 year life span max.

  743. It's alot of fun when you realize that what you thought was length 3 has suddenly become a length 1 shave.   746. After a lot of comparison shopping and using various products over the last ten years, I finally decided to purchase the Norelco T980. I am delighted with my purchase and it exceeded my expectations in every way.<br /><br />This unit is light, easy to operate, rechargeable and has precision blades that cut evenly. The extra attachment for fine detail works well and I don't get cut using it. The vacuum attachment works well even when it's not on Turbo and I personally think it's very quiet. It's unrealistic to think a mechanical device in this price range won't make any noise at all. If that's your expectation, you might want to use scissors. However, this product gets the job done much quicker and the sound is not annoying and unlikely to wake up someone else on the normal setting.<br /><br />The flexible blade housing pivots smoothly and covered the contours of my face very well with an even cut at several different lengths. While it's difficult to get close to the nose because of the larger size of this unit, I don't see that as a big deal because with the smaller precision tool you can do this quite easily with a mustache comb if you are not much for completely manual operations. This little bit of extra work probably took me under 30 seconds.<br /><br />Overall, the design of this unit is well thought out and it is quite attractive. The holding space for clippings is pretty big and unless you have a thick beard, you probably won't have to change it until after several uses. The battery also lasts about 30 minutes on Turbo and you can use the plug-in adapter after that if it runs out.<br /><br />I don't see any drawbacks at all with this product. I'm completely delighted with my purchase and the value that I received for my investment.
  747. I have used Norelco beard trimmers for at least the past 10 years. I have always been happy in the past and the T980 is no exception to that. Enhancements that my old Norelco didn't have include the turbo vacuum, which works well at containing the mess and the separate moustache trimmer, which worked well. Also, despite what many have written, I did not find the turbo vacuum to be excessively loud and the zoom length definitely *locked* into place at #3. All-in-all, another winner from Norelco!

  749. This is an awsome trimmer at a great price. I love that it has a vacuum suction for the trimmed hair and it does a good job of capturing most of the hair. you can also use it while it is plugged in, which you could not do with the older model trimmers.
  750. A beard trimmer with a built-in vacuum to keep the trimmings from collecting all over your sink is a good thing. So when I decided it was time to replace my Wahl Vacu-Trim, which needed new blades and battery, I was sorry to see that Wahl apparently no longer makes that model. It seems that the only vacuum beard trimmers available at this writing are the two models from Philips Norelco. Seeing a good price here at amazon, I sprang for the Turbo model, which promised a little extra oomph. Well, the trimmer works very well. Better than the Wahl, I think. To my surprise, I like the look it gives me at the closest setting -- if I didn't know better, I would say it makes an old geezer like me look younger. I haven't had the problems others describe with the length comb changing settings on me. The nicad battery life is acceptable -- I get a week of trims on my full beard and moustache at the Turbo setting. When you see the red light come on after turning the unit off -- figure you have one more trim at Turbo speed. Then it's time to recharge. The unit is a little large, but not unwieldy. I will be interested to see how well the blades hold up to the \\"ever-sharp\\" claim. No lubrication needed either! I am deducting one star because of failings in the instructions and packaging. The instructions never tell you which side of the trimmer to hold against your face, and the T980 works the opposite of most other trimmers and shavers. Most others have you hold the side with the buttons and logo against your face; when you use the length comb on the T980, however,you hold it with the buttons and logo on the side facing AWAY from your face. I wonder how many of my fellow reviewers have been using this trimmer correctly, given this unconventional orientation. Nowhere in the instructions do they show a clear photo of a guy using the trimmer. There are two tiny, hard-to-follow line illustrations. Adding insult to injury, the first time I called Norelco for help, the woman rep on the phone -- adding helpfully that she had never used a beard trimmer herself -- gave me the wrong answer. Further experimentation -- and another call to a male rep -- confirmed that I was using the trimmer correctly. The other problem with the packaging is the dreadful plastic blister pack holding the trimmer and accessories inside the box. Any package requiring scissors to open needs to be redesigned with more eco- and user-friendly materials!!! At any rate, the T980 is the current state-of-the-art in vacuum beard trimmers, and I recommend it, the packaging notwithstanding.e woman rep on the phone -- adding helpfully that she had never used a beard trimmer herself -- gave me the wrong answer. Further experimentation -- and another call to a male rep -- confirmed that I was using the trimmer correctly. The other problem with the packaging is the dreadful plastic blister pack holding the trimmer and accessories inside the box. Any package requiring scissors to open needs to be redesigned with more eco- and user-friendly materials!!! At any rate, the T980 is the current state-of-the-art in vacuum beard trimmers, and I recommend it, the packaging notwithstanding.
  751. People compalin about everything. This product is awesome. I had a Remington vacuum shave that worked fine but I decided to get this because it looked better. Well it looks good and outperforms my other one by battery power and performance. The blades never need to be oiled, the see through hair chamber is awesome, and the powerful hair vacuum are all you need. Not to mention it trims like a champ. This gets twice as close as any trimmer I have owned. You will love it. Quit being cheap and buy it or stay looking like an ape without a date.
  752. There have been a lot of complaints about the vacuum option of this trimmer. Let's be realistic....its not a Hoover, it's a trimmer. It catches MOST of the hairs, which is a lot better than NONE of the hairs. I've used it a few times so far and haven't had the problem others complained about where the setting is changed mid-trim. Just hold the thing below the dial, and not right on the dial. It gave a nice even trim all around. I've had it for a couple of months, used it 3-4 times, and still haven't had to recharge it. Suggested improvement - A stand would have been great so I could put it in my medicine cabinet and not have it roll around my counter. Tips for using - I found you're better off with dry hair. When the hair's wet, it's harder for the vacuum to pull it in. I also found that the vacuum works much better on longer hair then on shorter hair. Maybe the shorter hairs are too light and get blown around? Last but not least, watch out for the settings. The dial goes 1-9 so I started with 4, which was way too short. I could have grown that beard from scratch in a couple of weeks. 5 also proved a little short for me. Be sure to start a lot higher than you think you need, and work your way down if needed.
  753. The T980 is a very good trimmer. It cuts well, has the attachment for more precise trimming, holds a good charge, has the corded/cordless feature that predecessors did not, and still has a fair price. My only complaint is that the vacuum, even on turbo, still doesn't catch all of the trimmings. Previous norelco vacuum trimmers did not either, but I thought with the turbo that it would. The height adjustment is great too, those that complain about it moving out of the number need to stop smashing it into their face and keep their hand away from the adjuster.
  754. I bought this trimmer for I believe it was 18 dollars on a random sale day I guess . I was looking at it for some time and when I found at at this price (with a coupon code), it was a steal. The trimmer itself is very well made and sturdy. The pieces come apart pretty easily and clean quickly. I absolutely love the vacuum function. As long as you trim relatively slowly and carefully it will pick up about 90% of the hair its clipping. A few little ones can get by the trap, but it is extremely efficient with proper use. If you are in a bit of a rush and trim quickly, it will of course miss a few more hairs but manages to still suck up about 70% of what its cutting. The turbo mode is useful if you have a lot of hair you are getting rid of, but by no means a major factor. I am very happy with the purchase and if you have a decently full beard you like to keep trim, it is a great product. I would recommend it at the MSRP, but if you can, keep your eyes out and maybe you can find it for the absurdly low price I found it for...Good luck.
  755. Lots of plusses: It works and is attractive. The charge is lasting longer than I expected it to, but I have only charged it once. I did not experience the problems most frequently reported by others. This vacuum works very well; the \\"turbo\\" vacuum setting is somewhat louder but does not bother me at all. I have not experienced any of the \\"down shifting\\" on the trim height dial due to pressure, as reported by others. I even tried to get it to do this, and mine would not. It has an attractive design, which doesn't matter much to me but is an added plus that makes it more enjoyable to use. It works quite well without the comb housing to clean up the back of my neck between haircuts. The negatives are minor, but are as follows: My biggest peeve is that there is a little blue rectangular spring-loaded vaccum mouthpiece right in front of the blade, which sucks the hair into the vaccum. I suppose something like this is necessary from an engineering point of view to get the vaccum to work effectively. However, it seems that this also limits the ability of the hair to get to the blade from that direction, which limits the blade's effectiveness. This is somewhat frustrating, as one has to go over the same areas more than I used to with my old similar model. Also, it makes it hard to use the trimmer with the comb housing off to trim the hair around my ear, which I like to do between haircuts. I can do this if I use my index fingernail to carefully hold down the blue piece. This puts my finger quite close to the blade and makes me a little nervous that I'm going to slice through my finger. The comb attachment has a spring-loaded base feature. It just seems like something that will break at some point and adds no real functionality. I agree the case is a bit lame; it could be more rigid or padded, but if you travel with it, just roll it up inside an item of clothing and it will very likely survive just fine. The case should have separate compartments inside for the charger and the trimmer, so the plug doesn't scratch up the trimmer surface.
  756. I've had a couple of Norelco trimmers in the past, most recently the T780, and have never really been happy. This newer, top-of-the-line T980 is pretty much what I've been looking for. It's solid, powerful and holds a charge through several trimmings. And the length setting holds! (Previous models would change settings as you were trimming because the change ring was right under your grip and moved too easily.) I think I'll keep this one for a while.
  757. works pretty good all around. the vacuum feature is pretty good but it doesn't catch all the hairs. the trimmer is much larger than i thought it would be. its very loud ! charging is a pain, your not supposed to leave it plugged in for longer than the rapid charge time (about 2 hrs for mine). battery life is good and if it goes dead you can run the trimmer off of the charging cord. this trimmer is better than my Wahl and cost less i recommend this trimmer

The only reason I purchased a new one is the charger broke and I had no way to recharge the battery and because it was over 4 years old figured the battery did not have much life in it.
  759. Of coarse buying a product from Amazon directly you know you'll automatically get excellent shipping!!!!!!! This product works, and works well. What else can I say.   761. I've owned a few trimmers over the few years, and none had a built in vacuum. After losing the power cord to my last one, I went shopping and found this gem. The vacuum intrigued me -- would it really be worth the extra $20-25 over a standard trimmer? One word: Yes.<br /><br />I'd always put off shaving my beard due to the necessity of cleaning up afterwards. I just trimmed my beard, which had grown out over the past two weeks, and amazingly, the sink below me only had a few pieces of hair in it. That is totally acceptable in my book, and with this I'll be keeping my beard trimmed often because cleanup isn't a hassle anymore.<br /><br />Highly recommended. I can't speak for longevity, except that the trimmer I'm replacing was a Norelco that I bought almost two years ago, and it's still running (albeit it just died because I can't charge it anymore).
  762. I researched all of the Norelco beard trimmers before deciding to buy on Amazon. I read all of the reviews and noted some of the negatives like noise and the fact that the shaver doesn't \\"vaccum\\" all of the whiskers. I must say I haven't seen much of these negatives. The trimmer works great and beats my old Braun which did not collect whiskers. I would say that 90% of the whiskers are collected in the compartment rather than on my bathroom counter. The noise in my opinion is to be expected given the cutting and vacuum action being performed. I especially like the carrying case and accessory trimmer that are included with this model. The only negative I have noted is that the trimmer settings are not real precise. If I want a real clean look I have to go all the way down to the lowest setting and my goatee needs trimming about every 3 days. For the guys who are able to keep their beards a little longer this is probably not much of an issue.<br /><br />I highly recommend this shaver if you are wanting a clean, neat trim.
  763. I don't know where some of the negative reviews were coming from. This is my third trimmer since I started my beard about eight years ago. The others were ok, for awhile, but eventually just could not get the job done. This is my first Philips Norelco product. It is simply amazing! Never has beard trimming been so easy and the vacuum feature leaves almost no mess on the sink. The trimmer operates at a higher speed than previous ones and it's multitude of length settings allows for a perfect setting for me. The only negative I can think of is that the small trimmer head and brush don't fit neatly into the soft case. Otherwise, the product is a winner.
  764. works very well and with a great deal less mess as the trimmer has a suction to keep the hair from flying everywhere. It is easy to use. One minor problem one must clean the trimmer after each use and to take apart and to put back together and that is somewhat dificult at times.
  765. I purchased this electric razor when my old Phillips Norelco razor died on me. I had it for about 6 years so I figured I would stay with the company.   766. well, i had the older model of this trimmer for a couple of years now and decided it's time to get a new one. wasn't so impressed with the improvements though it is still the best trimmer i ever had. and i never shaved, so i know my trimmers. so, why wasnt i impressed: 1. super vacuum. just makes super noise. i still get hair in the sink, though a little less.... not really a big difference from the old model but an amazing feature! 2. when i use it without the level adapter (length 0) to trim the neck shorter, it somehow pinches me. very odd. i am blaming that on the self sharpening feature and hoping it'll improve in time. a major difference in this model compared to the old one - you can use it connected to the outlet! so when the battery dies on you in the middle of a trim, you are not left with half your face unshaven. bottom line - killer trimmer. i like it. get it. update: no more pinching. the self sharpening was the issue. works smoothly now. the vacuum feature is still not really what i expected it to be. still have to clean up after i'm done. a little annoying, but way better than the ones without vacuum capability
  767. I bought this for my dad for Father's Day and he says he likes is
  768. I really like this trimmer. I have a full beard, and have been using this trimmer several times a week for the last couple of years or so. Even with that amount of use it holds a charge for a really long time. It has a &#34;turbo&#34; boost setting, but I rarely ever use it; it does a fine job on regular speed. And the vacuum feature works really well. I've been through several other kinds of trimmers over the years, but this one is by far the best. The only thing I'd change on it if I could is the size of the numbers that indicate the closeness setting. I'm getting older and can't see the numbers very well, especially first thing in the morning. On a couple of occasions I've forgotten that I set it really low, and have already shaved off an eyebrow and one side of my mustache, and ran a bald furrow down my beard on the side of my cheek. But it cuts really good, I'll give it that!
  769. I've had a beard for decades and used a corded hair cutter with guide to \\"mow\\" it every now and then. But it made a mess of the bathroom counter and sink even when I spread newspaper to catch the clippings. I bought this a few years ago so I know the build quality is solid. The depth setting is easy and cutter head can be switched to a micro-head to do detail trim and borders. The best thing is that is vacuums the clippings at the source. It does not get every hair but nearly all. Much improvement over the old way. The charge lasts for some time so I only charge it every month or even less. It was the best rated in Consumers Report and other reviews and I cannot disagree. It is the best beard trimmer on the market.
  770. This item holds a charge for a very long time and the vacuum functionality works very good..
  771. I'm a person who has used several types of clippers in the past, both corded and cordless and I've gotta say this is one of the best! Originally discovered it on Amazon when I was in the market to replace my former cordless clipper and was impressed by the high rating. Now I'm singing its praises too.<br /><br />I've been using it for over a year now and would definitely buy another if I had to... but I don't! It's still going strong with a powerful battery and the suction of loose hair even allows me to shave in the car when I'm pressed for time. I would say as long as you shave in the proper direction (where the blade cuts first and the suction thingy follows) the shaver will suck in at least 85% of the loose hair it cuts. Usually I have very little hair left on the sink after I shave. The fact that it's cordless is a plus and the device gives just enough options with the adjustable guard and the precision blade. A full charge last me long enough for me to forget when was the last time I charged it and I love the fact that it's a good size and weight for travel. A great buy at a good price!
  772. I'm very disappointed with this trimmer. The thing that made me buy it is the thing that makes this unusable. I speak of the vacuum. It does a good job at keeping the hair out of the sink, but its placement sets the trimmer so far back from the guard that using this trimmer on setting 2 (which is what I always used on my old Norelco T7500 to keep it nice and tight) is the equivalent of setting 7 or so (which is fairly long) on my old trimmer so I am unable to get a nice tight, trim look. Using it on a mustache is useless especially right underneath your nose. It is simply impossible to angle the trimmer in such a way as to trim the hair. I have attempted to use this trimmer twice and both times have had to result to pulling my very old T7500 out of the drawer and using it to get a decent trim. Even setting this thing on the closest setting (#1) the trimmer still sets back waaaaay too far from the guard to be useful. If you contort you wrists and elbows you can get a fairly close trim on setting 1, but it is a giant pain to have to keep twisting and turning this trimmer around to achieve an even halfway decent trim. This thing is done. I'm shopping around for another brand. I've been a Norelco user for over 10 years, but they blew it with this one!

  790. This is not a knock your socks off trimmer but it is an excellent trimmer for the money! I bought it as a no bull trimmer for my father who has multiple levels of a beard and mustache. He now has no problem finding the correct length trimmer guides or deal with a pile of clippings because the trimmer pretty much takes care of that for him. The only thing that could be a bit better is the regular speed vacuum misses some clippings when being rushed through the clipping of your beard, but I guess thats why they made this clipper with a &#34;turbo&#34; function that increases the speed of the blades and increases vacuum at the same time. The only other thought I have about it is the clipping trap itself is small if you have a heavy beard or let it grow to long before clipping again but you could always empty it while clipping in the garbage and continue clipping.<br /><br />Overall an excellent trimmer!
